56 namespace ppq_local {

58 /*!
59  * A random-access iterator class for block oriented data. The iterator is
60  * intended to be provided by the internal_array and external_array classes
61  * and to be used by the multiway_merge algorithm as input iterators.
62  *
63  * \tparam ValueType the value type
64  */
65 template <class ValueType>
66 class ppq_iterator
67 {
68 public:
69  typedef ValueType value_type;
70  typedef value_type& reference;
71  typedef value_type* pointer;
72  typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
73  typedef std::random_access_iterator_tag iterator_category;
74  typedef std::vector<std::pair<pointer, pointer> > block_pointers_type;
75 
76 protected:
77  typedef ppq_iterator self_type;
78 
79  //! pointer to a vector of begin/end pointer pairs
80  //! They allow access to the data blocks.
81  const block_pointers_type* m_block_pointers;
82 
83  //! pointer to the current element
84  pointer m_current;
85 
86  //! index of the current element
87  size_t m_index;
88 
89  //! index of the current element's block
90  size_t m_block_index;
91 
92  //! size of each data block
93  size_t m_block_items;
94 
95 public:
96  //! default constructor (should not be used directly)
97  ppq_iterator()
98  : m_block_pointers(NULL)
99  { }
100 
101  //! constructor
102  //!
103  //! \param block_pointers A reference to the properly initialized vector of begin and end pointers.
104  //! One pair for each block. The pointers should be valid for all blocks that
105  //! are expected to be accessed with this iterator.
106  //! \param block_items The size of a single block. If there is only one block (e.g. if the iterator
107  //! belongs to an internal_array), use the total size here.
108  //! \param index The index of the current element (global - index 0 belongs to the first element
109  //! in the first block, no matter if the values are still valid)
110  ppq_iterator(const block_pointers_type* block_pointers, size_t block_items,
111  size_t index)
112  : m_block_pointers(block_pointers),
113  m_index(index),
114  m_block_items(block_items)
115  {
116  update();
117  }
118 
119  //! returns the value's index in the internal or external array
120  size_t get_index() const
121  {
122  return m_index;
123  }
124 
125  reference operator * () const
126  {
127  assert(m_current);
128  return *m_current;
129  }
130 
131  pointer operator -> () const
132  {
133  return &(operator * ());
134  }
135 
136  reference operator [] (difference_type relative_index) const
137  {
138  const difference_type index = m_index + relative_index;
139 
140  const size_t block_index = index / m_block_items;
141  const size_t local_index = index % m_block_items;
142 
143  assert(block_index < m_block_pointers->size());
144  assert((*m_block_pointers)[block_index].first + local_index
145  < (*m_block_pointers)[block_index].second);
146 
147  return *((*m_block_pointers)[block_index].first + local_index);
148  }
149 
150  //! prefix-increment operator
151  self_type& operator ++ ()
152  {
153  ++m_index;
154  ++m_current;
155 
156  if (UNLIKELY(m_current == (*m_block_pointers)[m_block_index].second)) {
157  if (m_block_index + 1 < m_block_pointers->size()) {
158  m_current = (*m_block_pointers)[++m_block_index].first;
159  }
160  else {
161  // global end
162  assert(m_block_index + 1 == m_block_pointers->size());
163  m_current = (*m_block_pointers)[m_block_index++].second;
164  }
165  }
166 
167  return *this;
168  }
169  //! prefix-decrement operator
170  self_type& operator -- ()
171  {
172  assert(m_index > 0);
173  --m_index;
174 
175  if (m_block_index >= m_block_pointers->size()
176  || m_current == (*m_block_pointers)[m_block_index].first) {
177  // begin of current block or global end
178  assert(m_block_index > 0);
179  assert(m_block_index <= m_block_pointers->size());
180  m_current = (*m_block_pointers)[--m_block_index].second - 1;
181  }
182  else {
183  --m_current;
184  }
185 
186  return *this;
187  }
188 
189  self_type operator + (difference_type addend) const
190  {
191  return self_type(m_block_pointers, m_block_items, m_index + addend);
192  }
193  self_type& operator += (difference_type addend)
194  {
195  m_index += addend;
196  update();
197  return *this;
198  }
199  self_type operator - (difference_type subtrahend) const
200  {
201  return self_type(m_block_pointers, m_block_items, m_index - subtrahend);
202  }
203  difference_type operator - (const self_type& o) const
204  {
205  return (m_index - o.m_index);
206  }
207  self_type& operator -= (difference_type subtrahend)
208  {
209  m_index -= subtrahend;
210  update();
211  return *this;
212  }
213  bool operator == (const self_type& o) const
214  {
215  return m_index == o.m_index;
216  }
217  bool operator != (const self_type& o) const
218  {
219  return m_index != o.m_index;
220  }
221  bool operator < (const self_type& o) const
222  {
223  return m_index < o.m_index;
224  }
225  bool operator <= (const self_type& o) const
226  {
227  return m_index <= o.m_index;
228  }
229  bool operator > (const self_type& o) const
230  {
231  return m_index > o.m_index;
232  }
233  bool operator >= (const self_type& o) const
234  {
235  return m_index >= o.m_index;
236  }
237 
238  friend std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& os, const ppq_iterator& i)
239  {
240  return os << "[" << i.m_index << "]";
241  }
242 
243 private:
244  //! updates m_block_index and m_current based on m_index
245  inline void update()
246  {
247  m_block_index = m_index / m_block_items;
248  const size_t local_index = m_index % m_block_items;
249 
250  if (m_block_index < m_block_pointers->size()) {
251  m_current = (*m_block_pointers)[m_block_index].first + local_index;
252  assert(m_current <= (*m_block_pointers)[m_block_index].second);
253  }
254  else {
255  // global end if end is beyond the last real block
256  assert(m_block_index == m_block_pointers->size());
257  assert(local_index == 0);
258  //-tb old: m_current = (*m_block_pointers)[m_block_index - 1].second;
259  m_current = NULL;
260  }
261  }
262 };
263 
264 /*!
265  * Internal arrays store a sorted sequence of values in RAM, which will be
266  * merged together into the deletion buffer when it needs to be
267  * refilled. Internal arrays are constructed from the insertions heaps when
268  * they overflow.
269  */
270 template <class ValueType>
271 class internal_array : private noncopyable
272 {
273 public:
274  typedef ValueType value_type;
275  typedef ppq_iterator<value_type> iterator;
276 
277 protected:
278  typedef typename iterator::block_pointers_type block_pointers_type;
279 
280  //! Contains the items of the sorted sequence.
281  std::vector<value_type> m_values;
282 
283  //! Index of the current head
284  unsigned_type m_min_index;
285 
286  //! Level of internal array (Sander's PQ: group number)
287  unsigned_type m_level;
288 
289  //! Begin and end pointers of the array
290  //! This is used by the iterator
291  block_pointers_type m_block_pointers;
292 
293 public:
294  //! Default constructor. Don't use this directy. Needed for regrowing in
295  //! surrounding vector.
296  internal_array() : m_min_index(0) { }
297 
298  //! Constructor which takes a value vector. The value vector is empty
299  //! afterwards.
300  internal_array(std::vector<value_type>& values,
301  unsigned_type min_index = 0,
302  unsigned_type level = 0)
303  : m_values(), m_min_index(min_index), m_level(level),
304  m_block_pointers(1)
305  {
306  std::swap(m_values, values);
307  m_block_pointers[0] = std::make_pair(&(*m_values.begin()), &(*m_values.end()));
308  }
309 
310  //! Swap internal_array with another one.
311  void swap(internal_array& o)
312  {
313  using std::swap;
314 
315  swap(m_values, o.m_values);
316  swap(m_min_index, o.m_min_index);
317  swap(m_level, o.m_level);
318  swap(m_block_pointers, o.m_block_pointers);
319  }
320 
321  //! Swap internal_array with another one.
322  friend void swap(internal_array& a, internal_array& b)
323  {
324  a.swap(b);
325  }
326 
327  //! Random access operator
328  inline value_type& operator [] (size_t i)
329  {
330  return m_values[i];
331  }
332 
333  //! Use inc_min(diff) if multiple values have been extracted.
334  inline void inc_min(size_t diff = 1)
335  {
336  m_min_index += diff;
337  }
338 
339  //! The currently smallest element in the array.
340  inline const value_type & get_min() const
341  {
342  return m_values[m_min_index];
343  }
344 
345  //! The index of the currently smallest element in the array.
346  inline size_t get_min_index() const
347  {
348  return m_min_index;
349  }
350 
351  //! The index of the largest element in the array.
352  inline size_t get_max_index() const
353  {
354  return (m_values.size() - 1);
355  }
356 
357  //! Returns if the array has run empty.
358  inline bool empty() const
359  {
360  return (m_min_index >= m_values.size());
361  }
362 
363  //! Make this array empty.
364  inline void make_empty()
365  {
366  m_min_index = m_values.size();
367  }
368 
369  //! Returns the current size of the array.
370  inline size_t size() const
371  {
372  return (m_values.size() - m_min_index);
373  }
374 
375  //! Returns the initial size of the array.
376  inline size_t capacity() const
377  {
378  return m_values.size();
379  }
380 
381  //! Returns the level (group number) of the array.
382  inline unsigned_type level() const
383  {
384  return m_level;
385  }
386 
387  //! Return the amount of internal memory used by an array with the capacity
388  //! in number of items.
389  static size_t int_memory(size_t capacity)
390  {
391  return sizeof(internal_array) + capacity * sizeof(value_type);
392  }
393 
394  //! Return the amount of internal memory used by the array
395  inline size_t int_memory() const
396  {
397  return int_memory(m_values.capacity());
398  }
399 
400  //! Begin iterator
401  inline iterator begin() const
402  {
403  // not const, unfortunately.
404  return iterator(&m_block_pointers, capacity(), m_min_index);
405  }
406 
407  //! End iterator
408  inline iterator end() const
409  {
410  // not const, unfortunately.
411  return iterator(&m_block_pointers, capacity(), capacity());
412  }
413 };
414 
415 template <class ExternalArrayType>
416 class external_array_writer;
417 
418 /*!
419  * External array stores a sorted sequence of values on the hard disk and
420  * allows access to the first block (containing the smallest values). The
421  * class uses buffering and prefetching in order to improve the performance.
422  *
423  * \tparam ValueType Type of the contained objects (POD with no references to
424  * internal memory).
425  *
426  * \tparam BlockSize External block size. Default =
427  * STXXL_DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE(ValueType).
428  *
429  * \tparam AllocStrategy Allocation strategy for the external memory. Default =
430  * STXXL_DEFAULT_ALLOC_STRATEGY.
431  */
432 template <
433  class ValueType,
434  unsigned_type BlockSize = STXXL_DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE(ValueType),
435  class AllocStrategy = STXXL_DEFAULT_ALLOC_STRATEGY
436  >
437 class external_array : private noncopyable
438 {
439 public:
440  typedef ValueType value_type;
441  typedef ppq_iterator<value_type> iterator;
442 
443  typedef external_array<value_type, BlockSize, AllocStrategy> self_type;
444  typedef typed_block<BlockSize, value_type> block_type;
445  typedef read_write_pool<block_type> pool_type;
446  typedef std::vector<BID<BlockSize> > bid_vector;
447  typedef typename bid_vector::iterator bid_iterator;
448  typedef std::vector<block_type*> block_vector;
449  typedef std::vector<request_ptr> request_vector;
450  typedef std::vector<value_type> minima_vector;
451  typedef typename iterator::block_pointers_type block_pointers_type;
452  typedef external_array_writer<self_type> writer_type;
453 
454  //! The number of elements fitting into one block
455  enum {
456  block_size = BlockSize,
457  block_items = BlockSize / sizeof(value_type)
458  };
459 
460  static const bool debug = false;
461 
462 protected:
463  //! The total size of the external array in items. Cannot be changed
464  //! after construction.
465  external_size_type m_capacity;
466 
467  //! Number of blocks, again: calculated at construction time.
468  unsigned_type m_num_blocks;
469 
470  //! Level of external array (Sander's PQ: group number)
471  unsigned_type m_level;
472 
473  //! Common prefetch and write buffer pool
474  pool_type* m_pool;
475 
476  //! The IDs of each block in external memory.
477  bid_vector m_bids;
478 
479  //! A vector of size m_num_blocks with block_type pointers, some of them
480  //! will be filled while writing, but most are NULL.
481  block_vector m_blocks;
482 
483  //! Begin and end pointers for each block, used for merging with
484  //! ppq_iterator.
485  block_pointers_type m_block_pointers;
486 
487  //! The read request pointers are used to wait until the block has been
488  //! completely fetched.
489  request_vector m_requests;
490 
491  //! stores the minimum value of each block
492  minima_vector m_minima;
493 
494  //! Is array in write phase? True = write phase, false = read phase.
495  bool m_write_phase;
496 
497  //! The total number of elements minus the number of extracted values
498  external_size_type m_size;
499 
500  //! The read position in the array.
501  external_size_type m_index;
502 
503  //! The index behind the last element that is located in RAM (or is at
504  //! least requested to be so)
505  external_size_type m_end_index;
506 
507  //! The first unhinted block index.
508  unsigned_type m_unhinted_block;
509 
510  //! The first unhinted block index as it was before the
511  //! prepare_rebuilding_hints() call. Used for removal of hints which aren't
512  //! needed anymore.
513  unsigned_type m_old_unhinted_block;
514 
515  //! allow writer to access to all variables
516  friend class external_array_writer<self_type>;
517 
518 public:
519  /*!
520  * Constructs an external array
521  *
522  * \param size The total number of elements. Cannot be changed after
523  * construction.
524  *
525  * \param num_prefetch_blocks Number of blocks to prefetch from hard disk
526  *
527  * \param num_write_buffer_blocks Size of the write buffer in number of
528  * blocks
529  */
530  external_array(external_size_type size, pool_type* pool, unsigned_type level = 0)
531  : // constants
532  m_capacity(size),
533  m_num_blocks((size_t)div_ceil(m_capacity, block_items)),
534  m_level(level),
535  m_pool(pool),
536 
537  // vectors
538  m_bids(m_num_blocks),
539  m_blocks(m_num_blocks, reinterpret_cast<block_type*>(1)),
540  m_block_pointers(m_num_blocks),
541  m_requests(m_num_blocks, NULL),
542  m_minima(m_num_blocks),
543 
544  // state
545  m_write_phase(true),
546 
547  // indices
548  m_size(0),
549  m_index(0),
550  m_end_index(0),
551  m_unhinted_block(0),
552  m_old_unhinted_block(0)
553  {
554  assert(m_capacity > 0);
555  // allocate blocks in EM.
556  block_manager* bm = block_manager::get_instance();
557  bm->new_blocks(AllocStrategy(), m_bids.begin(), m_bids.end());
558  }
559 
560  //! Default constructor. Don't use this directy. Needed for regrowing in
561  //! surrounding vector.
562  external_array()
563  : // constants
564  m_capacity(0),
565  m_num_blocks(0),
566  m_level(0),
567  m_pool(NULL),
568 
569  // vectors
570  m_bids(0),
571  m_blocks(0),
572  m_block_pointers(0),
573  m_requests(0),
574  m_minima(0),
575 
576  // state
577  m_write_phase(false),
578 
579  // indices
580  m_size(0),
581  m_index(0),
582  m_end_index(0),
583  m_unhinted_block(0),
584  m_old_unhinted_block(0)
585  { }
586 
587  //! Swap external_array with another one.
588  void swap(external_array& o)
589  {
590  using std::swap;
591 
592  // constants
593  swap(m_capacity, o.m_capacity);
594  swap(m_num_blocks, o.m_num_blocks);
595  swap(m_level, o.m_level);
596  swap(m_pool, o.m_pool);
597 
598  // vectors
599  swap(m_bids, o.m_bids);
600  swap(m_requests, o.m_requests);
601  swap(m_blocks, o.m_blocks);
602  swap(m_block_pointers, o.m_block_pointers);
603  swap(m_minima, o.m_minima);
604 
605  // state
606  swap(m_write_phase, o.m_write_phase);
607 
608  // indices
609  swap(m_size, o.m_size);
610  swap(m_index, o.m_index);
611  swap(m_end_index, o.m_end_index);
612  swap(m_unhinted_block, o.m_unhinted_block);
613  swap(m_old_unhinted_block, o.m_old_unhinted_block);
614  }
615 
616  //! Swap external_array with another one.
617  friend void swap(external_array& a, external_array& b)
618  {
619  a.swap(b);
620  }
621 
622  //! Destructor
623  ~external_array()
624  {
625  if (m_size == 0) return;
626 
627  // not all data has been read! this only happen when the PPQ is
628  // destroyed while containing data.
629 
630  const unsigned_type block_index = m_index / block_items;
631  const unsigned_type end_block_index = get_end_block_index();
632 
633  // released blocks currently held in RAM
634  for (size_t i = block_index; i < end_block_index; ++i) {
635  m_pool->add_prefetch(m_blocks[i]);
636  // cannot report the number of freed blocks to PPQ.
637  }
638 
639  // cancel currently hinted blocks
640  for (size_t i = end_block_index; i < m_unhinted_block; ++i) {
641  STXXL_DEBUG("ea[" << this << "]: discarding prefetch hint on"
642  " block " << i);
643 
644  m_requests[i]->cancel();
645  m_requests[i]->wait();
646  // put block back into pool
647  m_pool->add_prefetch(m_blocks[i]);
648  // invalidate block entry
649  m_blocks[i] = NULL;
650  m_requests[i] = request_ptr();
651  }
652 
653  // figure out first block that is still allocated in EM.
654  bid_iterator i_begin = m_bids.begin() + block_index;
655  block_manager::get_instance()->delete_blocks(i_begin, m_bids.end());
656 
657  // check that all is empty
658  for (size_t i = block_index; i < end_block_index; ++i)
659  assert(m_blocks[i] == NULL);
660  }
661 
662  //! Returns the capacity in items.
663  size_t capacity() const
664  {
665  return m_capacity;
666  }
667 
668  //! Returns the current size in items.
669  size_t size() const
670  {
671  return m_size;
672  }
673 
674  //! Returns true if the array is empty.
675  bool empty() const
676  {
677  return (m_size == 0);
678  }
679 
680  //! Returns the level (group number) of the array.
681  inline unsigned_type level() const
682  {
683  return m_level;
684  }
685 
686  //! Return the number of blocks.
687  size_t num_blocks() const
688  {
689  return m_num_blocks;
690  }
691 
692  //! Returns memory usage of EA with given capacity, excluding blocks loaded
693  //! in RAM. Blocks belong to prefetch pool.
694  static size_t int_memory(size_t capacity)
695  {
696  size_t num_blocks = div_ceil(capacity, block_items);
697 
698  return sizeof(external_array)
699  + num_blocks * sizeof(typename bid_vector::value_type)
700  + num_blocks * sizeof(typename block_vector::value_type)
701  + num_blocks * sizeof(typename block_pointers_type::value_type)
702  + num_blocks * sizeof(typename request_vector::value_type)
703  + num_blocks * sizeof(typename minima_vector::value_type);
704  }
705 
706  //! Return the amount of internal memory used by the EA.
707  inline size_t int_memory() const
708  {
709  return int_memory(m_capacity);
710  }
711 
712  //! Returns the number elements available in internal memory
713  size_t buffer_size() const
714  {
715  return (m_end_index - m_index);
716  }
717 
718  //! Returns the block beyond the block in which *(m_end_index-1) is located.
719  unsigned_type get_end_block_index() const
720  {
721  unsigned_type end_block_index = m_end_index / block_items;
722 
723  // increase block index if inside the block
724  if (m_end_index % block_items != 0) ++end_block_index;
725  assert(end_block_index <= m_num_blocks);
726 
727  return end_block_index;
728  }
729 
730  //! Returns the block in which m_index is located.
731  inline unsigned_type get_current_block_index() const
732  {
733  return (m_index / block_items);
734  }
735 
736  //! Returns a random-access iterator to the begin of the data
737  //! in internal memory.
738  iterator begin() const
739  {
740  //-TODO?: assert(block_valid(m_index / block_items) || m_index == m_capacity);
741  return iterator(&m_block_pointers, block_items, m_index);
742  }
743 
744  //! Returns a random-access iterator 1 behind the end of the data
745  //! in internal memory.
746  iterator end() const
747  {
748  //-TODO? assert(!block_valid(m_end_index / block_items) || m_end_index == m_capacity);
749  return iterator(&m_block_pointers, block_items, m_end_index);
750  }
751 
752  //! Returns the smallest element in the array
753  const value_type & get_min()
754  {
755  return *begin();
756  }
757 
758  //! Returns if there is data in EM, that's not randomly accessible.
759  bool has_em_data() const
760  {
761  return (get_end_block_index() < m_num_blocks);
762  }
763 
764  //! Returns the smallest element of the first block NOT in internal memory
765  //! (or at least requested to be in internal memory)
766  const value_type & get_next_block_min() const
767  {
768  assert(get_end_block_index() < m_num_blocks);
769  return m_minima[get_end_block_index()];
770  }
771 
772  //! Returns if the data requested to be in internal memory is
773  //! completely fetched. True if wait() has been called before.
774  bool valid() const
775  {
776  bool result = true;
777  const unsigned_type block_index = m_index / block_items;
778  const unsigned_type end_block_index = get_end_block_index();
779  for (unsigned_type i = block_index; i < end_block_index; ++i) {
780  result = result && block_valid(i);
781  }
782  return result;
783  }
784 
785  //! Random access operator for data in internal memory
786  //! You should call wait() once after fetching data from EM.
787  value_type& operator [] (size_t i) const
788  {
789  assert(i < m_capacity);
790  const size_t block_index = i / block_items;
791  const size_t local_index = i % block_items;
792  assert(i < m_capacity);
793  assert(block_valid(block_index));
794  return m_blocks[block_index]->elem[local_index];
795  }
796 
797 public:
798  //! prepare the pool for writing external arrays with given number of
799  //! threads
800  static void prepare_write_pool(pool_type& pool, unsigned_type num_threads)
801  {
802  unsigned_type write_blocks = num_threads;
803  // need at least one
804  if (write_blocks == 0) write_blocks = 1;
805  // for holding boundary blocks
806  write_blocks *= 2;
807  // more disks than threads?
808  if (write_blocks < config::get_instance()->disks_number())
809  write_blocks = config::get_instance()->disks_number();
810 #if STXXL_DEBUG_ASSERTIONS
811  // required for re-reading the external array
812  write_blocks = 2 * write_blocks;
813 #endif
814  if (pool.size_write() < write_blocks) {
815  STXXL_ERRMSG("WARNING: enlarging PPQ write pool to " <<
816  write_blocks << " blocks = " <<
817  write_blocks * block_size / 1024 / 1024 << " MiB");
818  pool.resize_write(write_blocks);
819  }
820  }
821 
822 protected:
823  //! prepare the external_array for writing using multiway_merge() with
824  //! num_threads. this method is called by the external_array_writer's
825  //! constructor.
826  void prepare_write(unsigned_type num_threads)
827  {
828  prepare_write_pool(*m_pool, num_threads);
829  }
830 
831  //! finish the writing phase after multiway_merge() filled the vector. this
832  //! method is called by the external_array_writer's destructor..
833  void finish_write()
834  {
835  // check that all blocks where written
836  for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < m_num_blocks; ++i)
837  assert(m_blocks[i] == NULL);
838 
839  // compatibility to the block write interface
840  m_size = m_capacity;
841  m_index = 0;
842  m_end_index = 0;
843  m_unhinted_block = 0;
844 
845  m_write_phase = false;
846  }
847 
848  //! Called by the external_array_writer to read a block from disk into
849  //! m_blocks[]. If the block is marked as uninitialized, then no read is
850  //! performed. This is the usual case, and in theory, no block ever has be
851  //! re-read from disk, since all can be written fully. However, we do
852  //! support re-reading blocks for debugging purposes inside
853  //! multiway_merge(), in a full performance build re-reading never occurs.
854  void read_block(size_t block_index)
855  {
856  assert(block_index < m_num_blocks);
857  assert(m_blocks[block_index] == NULL ||
858  m_blocks[block_index] == reinterpret_cast<block_type*>(1));
859 
860  if (m_blocks[block_index] == reinterpret_cast<block_type*>(1))
861  {
862  // special marker: this block is uninitialized -> no need to read
863  // from disk.
864  m_blocks[block_index] = m_pool->steal();
865  }
866  else
867  {
868  // block was already written, have to read from EM.
869  STXXL_DEBUG("ea[" << this << "]: "
870  "read_block needs to re-read block index=" << block_index);
871 
872  static bool s_warned = false;
873  if (!s_warned)
874  {
875  s_warned = true;
876  STXXL_ERRMSG("ppq::external_array[" << this << "] "
877  "writer requested to re-read block from EM.");
878  STXXL_ERRMSG("This should never occur in full-performance mode, "
879  "verify that you run in debug mode.");
880  }
881 
882  // this re-reading is not necessary for full performance builds, so
883  // we immediately wait for the I/O to be completed.
884  m_blocks[block_index] = m_pool->steal();
885  request_ptr req = m_pool->read(m_blocks[block_index], m_bids[block_index]);
886  req->wait();
887  assert(req->poll());
888  assert(m_blocks[block_index]);
889  }
890  }
891 
892  //! Called by the external_array_writer to write a block from m_blocks[] to
893  //! disk. Prior to writing and releasing the memory, extra information is
894  //! preserved.
895  void write_block(size_t block_index)
896  {
897  assert(block_index < m_num_blocks);
898  assert(m_blocks[block_index] != NULL &&
899  m_blocks[block_index] != reinterpret_cast<block_type*>(1));
900 
901  // calculate minimum and maximum values
902  const internal_size_type this_block_items =
903  std::min<internal_size_type>(block_items, m_capacity - block_index * (external_size_type)block_items);
904 
905  STXXL_DEBUG("ea[" << this << "]: write_block index=" << block_index <<
906  " this_block_items=" << this_block_items);
907 
908  assert(this_block_items > 0);
909  block_type& this_block = *m_blocks[block_index];
910 
911  m_minima[block_index] = this_block[0];
912 
913  // write out block (in background)
914  m_pool->write(m_blocks[block_index], m_bids[block_index]);
915 
916  m_blocks[block_index] = NULL;
917  }
918 
919 public:
920  //! \name Prefetching Hints
921  //! \{
922 
923  //! Prefetch the next unhinted block, requires one free read block from the
924  //! global pool.
925  void hint_next_block()
926  {
927  assert(m_unhinted_block < m_num_blocks);
928 
929  // will read (prefetch) block i
930  size_t i = m_unhinted_block++;
931 
932  STXXL_DEBUG("ea[" << this << "]: prefetching block_index=" << i);
933 
934  assert(m_pool->size_write() > 0);
935  assert(m_blocks[i] == NULL);
936 
937  // steal block from pool, but also perform read via pool, since this
938  // checks the associated write_pool.
939  m_blocks[i] = m_pool->steal_prefetch();
940  m_requests[i] = m_pool->read(m_blocks[i], m_bids[i]);
941  }
942 
943  //! Returns if there is data in EM, that's not already hinted
944  //! to the prefetcher.
945  bool has_unhinted_em_data() const
946  {
947  return (m_unhinted_block < m_num_blocks);
948  }
949 
950  //! Returns the smallest element of the next hint candidate (the block
951  //! after the last hinted one).
952  const value_type & get_next_hintable_min() const
953  {
954  assert(m_unhinted_block < m_num_blocks);
955  return m_minima[m_unhinted_block];
956  }
957 
958  //! Returns the number of hinted blocks.
959  size_t num_hinted_blocks() const
960  {
961  assert(get_end_block_index() <= m_unhinted_block);
962  return m_unhinted_block - get_end_block_index();
963  }
964 
965  //! This method prepares rebuilding the hints (this is done after creating
966  //! a new EA in order to always have globally the n blocks hinted which
967  //! will be fetched first). Resets m_unhinted_block to the first block not
968  //! in RAM. Thereafter prehint_next_block() is used to advance this index.
969  //! finish_rebuilding_hints() should be called after placing all hints in
970  //! order to clean up the prefetch pool.
971  void rebuild_hints_prepare()
972  {
973  m_old_unhinted_block = m_unhinted_block;
974  m_unhinted_block = get_end_block_index();
975  assert(get_end_block_index() <= m_old_unhinted_block);
976  }
977 
978  //! Advance m_unhinted_block index without actually prefetching.
979  void rebuild_hints_prehint_next_block()
980  {
981  assert(m_unhinted_block < m_num_blocks);
982 
983  // will read (prefetch) block after cancellations.
984 
985  STXXL_DEBUG("ea[" << this << "]: pre-hint of" <<
986  " block_index=" << m_unhinted_block);
987 
988  ++m_unhinted_block;
989  }
990 
991  //! Cancel hints which aren't needed anymore from the prefetcher and fixes
992  //! it's size. prepare_rebuilding_hints() must be called before!
993  void rebuild_hints_cancel()
994  {
995  for (size_t i = m_unhinted_block; i < m_old_unhinted_block; ++i) {
996  STXXL_DEBUG("ea[" << this << "]: discarding prefetch hint on"
997  " block " << i);
998  m_requests[i]->cancel();
999  m_requests[i]->wait();
1000  // put block back into pool
1001  m_pool->add_prefetch(m_blocks[i]);
1002  // invalidate block entry
1003  m_blocks[i] = NULL;
1004  m_requests[i] = request_ptr();
1005  }
1006  }
1007 
1008  //! Perform real-hinting of pre-hinted blocks, since now canceled blocks
1009  //! are available.
1010  void rebuild_hints_finish()
1011  {
1012  for (size_t i = m_old_unhinted_block; i < m_unhinted_block; ++i)
1013  {
1014  STXXL_DEBUG("ea[" << this << "]: perform real-hinting of"
1015  " block " << i);
1016 
1017  assert(m_pool->size_write() > 0);
1018  assert(m_blocks[i] == NULL);
1019  m_blocks[i] = m_pool->steal_prefetch();
1020  m_requests[i] = m_pool->read(m_blocks[i], m_bids[i]);
1021  }
1022  }
1023 
1024  //! \}
1025 
1026 public:
1027  //! \name Waiting and Removal
1028  //! \{
1029 
1030  //! Waits until the next prefetched block is read into RAM, then polls for
1031  //! any further blocks that are done as well. Returns how many blocks were
1032  //! successfully read.
1033  unsigned_type wait_next_blocks()
1034  {
1035  size_t begin = get_end_block_index(), i = begin;
1036 
1037  STXXL_DEBUG("ea[" << this << "]: waiting for" <<
1038  " block index=" << i <<
1039  " end_index=" << m_end_index);
1040 
1041  assert(has_em_data());
1042 
1043  assert(i < m_unhinted_block);
1044  assert(m_bids[i].valid());
1045  assert(m_requests[i].valid());
1046 
1047  // wait for prefetched request to finish.
1048  m_requests[i]->wait();
1049  assert(m_requests[i]->poll());
1050  assert(m_blocks[i]);
1051 
1052  update_block_pointers(i);
1053  ++i;
1054 
1055  // poll further hinted blocks if already done
1056  while (i < m_unhinted_block && m_requests[i]->poll())
1057  {
1058  STXXL_DEBUG("ea[" << this << "]: poll-ok for" <<
1059  " block index=" << i <<
1060  " end_index=" << m_end_index);
1061  m_requests[i]->wait();
1062  assert(m_requests[i]->poll());
1063  assert(m_blocks[i]);
1064 
1065  update_block_pointers(i);
1066  ++i;
1067  }
1068 
1069  m_end_index = std::min(m_capacity, i * (external_size_type)block_items);
1070 
1071  return i - begin;
1072  }
1073 
1074  //! Waits until all hinted blocks are read into RAM. Returns how many
1075  //! blocks were successfully read.
1076  unsigned_type wait_all_hinted_blocks()
1077  {
1078  size_t begin = get_end_block_index(), i = begin;
1079  while (i < m_unhinted_block)
1080  {
1081  STXXL_DEBUG("wait_all_hinted_blocks(): ea[" << this << "]: waiting for" <<
1082  " block index=" << i <<
1083  " end_index=" << m_end_index);
1084  m_requests[i]->wait();
1085  assert(m_requests[i]->poll());
1086  assert(m_blocks[i]);
1087  update_block_pointers(i);
1088  ++i;
1089  }
1090  m_end_index = std::min(m_capacity, i * (external_size_type)block_items);
1091  return i - begin;
1092  }
1093 
1094  //! Returns the number of blocks loaded in RAM.
1095  size_t num_used_blocks() const
1096  {
1097  return get_end_block_index() - (m_index / block_items);
1098  }
1099 
1100  //! Removes the first n elements from the array. Returns the number of
1101  //! blocks released into the block pool.
1102  unsigned_type remove_items(size_t n)
1103  {
1104  assert(m_index + n <= m_capacity);
1105  assert(m_index + n <= m_end_index);
1106  assert(m_size >= n);
1107 
1108  STXXL_DEBUG("ea[" << this << "]: remove " << n << " items");
1109 
1110  if (n == 0)
1111  return 0;
1112 
1113  const size_t block_index = m_index / block_items;
1114 
1115  const size_t index_after = m_index + n;
1116  size_t block_index_after = index_after / block_items;
1117  size_t local_index_after = index_after % block_items;
1118 
1119  if (m_size == n && local_index_after != 0) // end of EA
1120  ++block_index_after;
1121 
1122  assert(block_index_after <= m_num_blocks);
1123 
1124  bid_iterator i_begin = m_bids.begin() + block_index;
1125  bid_iterator i_end = m_bids.begin() + block_index_after;
1126  assert(i_begin <= i_end);
1127  block_manager::get_instance()->delete_blocks(i_begin, i_end);
1128 
1129  for (size_t i = block_index; i < block_index_after; ++i) {
1130  assert(block_valid(i));
1131  // return block to pool
1132  m_pool->add_prefetch(m_blocks[i]);
1133  }
1134 
1135  m_index = index_after;
1136  m_size -= n;
1137 
1138  unsigned_type blocks_freed = block_index_after - block_index;
1139 
1140  STXXL_DEBUG("ea[" << this << "]: after remove:" <<
1141  " index_after=" << index_after <<
1142  " block_index_after=" << block_index_after <<
1143  " local_index_after=" << local_index_after <<
1144  " blocks_freed=" << blocks_freed <<
1145  " num_blocks=" << m_num_blocks <<
1146  " capacity=" << m_capacity);
1147 
1148  assert(block_index_after <= m_num_blocks);
1149  // at most one block outside of the currently loaded range
1150  assert(block_index_after <= get_end_block_index());
1151 
1152  return blocks_freed;
1153  }
1154 
1155  //! \}
1156 
1157 protected:
1158  //! Returns if the block with the given index is completely fetched.
1159  bool block_valid(size_t block_index) const
1160  {
1161  if (!m_write_phase) {
1162  if (block_index >= m_num_blocks) return false;
1163  return (m_requests[block_index] && m_requests[block_index]->poll());
1164  }
1165  else {
1166  return (bool)m_blocks[block_index];
1167  }
1168  }
1169 
1170  //! Updates the m_block_pointers vector.
1171  //! Should be called after any steal() or read() operation.
1172  //! This is necessary for the iterators to work properly.
1173  inline void update_block_pointers(size_t block_index)
1174  {
1175  STXXL_DEBUG("ea[" << this << "]: updating block pointers for " << block_index);
1176 
1177  m_block_pointers[block_index].first = m_blocks[block_index]->begin();
1178  if (block_index + 1 != m_num_blocks)
1179  m_block_pointers[block_index].second = m_blocks[block_index]->end();
1180  else
1181  m_block_pointers[block_index].second =
1182  m_block_pointers[block_index].first
1183  + (m_capacity - block_index * block_items);
1184 
1185  assert(m_block_pointers[block_index].first != NULL);
1186  assert(m_block_pointers[block_index].second != NULL);
1187  }
1188 
1189  inline size_t last_block_items()
1190  {
1191  size_t mod = m_capacity % block_items;
1192  return (mod > 0) ? mod : (size_t)block_items;
1193  }
1194 };
1195 
1196 /**
1197  * An external_array can only be written using an external_array_writer
1198  * object. The writer objects provides iterators which are designed to be used
1199  * by stxxl::parallel::multiway_merge() to write the external memory blocks in
1200  * parallel. Thus in the writer we coordinate thread-safe access to the blocks
1201  * using reference counting.
1202  *
1203  * An external_array_writer::iterator has two states: normal and "live". In
1204  * normal mode, the iterator only has a valid index into the external array's
1205  * items. In normal mode, only index calculations are possible. Once
1206  * operator*() is called, the iterators goes into "live" mode by requesting
1207  * access to the corresponding block. Using reference counting the blocks is
1208  * written once all iterators are finished with the corresponding block. Since
1209  * with operator*() we cannot know if the value is going to be written or read,
1210  * when going to live mode, the block must be read from EM. This read overhead,
1211  * however, is optimized by marking blocks as uninitialized in external_array,
1212  * and skipping reads for then. In a full performance build, no block needs to
1213  * be read from disk. Reads only occur in debug mode, when the results are
1214  * verify.
1215  *
1216  * The iterator's normal/live mode only stays active for the individual
1217  * iterator object. When an iterator is copied/assigned/calculated with the
1218  * mode is NOT inherited! The exception is prefix operator ++, which is used by
1219  * multiway_merge() to fill an array. Thus the implementation of the iterator
1220  * heavily depends on the behavior of multiway_merge() and is optimized for it.
1221  */
1222 template <class ExternalArrayType>
1223 class external_array_writer : public noncopyable
1224 {
1225 public:
1226  typedef ExternalArrayType ea_type;
1227 
1228  typedef external_array_writer self_type;
1229 
1230  typedef typename ea_type::value_type value_type;
1231  typedef typename ea_type::block_type block_type;
1232 
1233  //! prototype declaration of nested class.
1234  class iterator;
1235 
1236  //! scope based debug variable
1237  static const bool debug = false;
1238 
1239 protected:
1240  //! reference to the external array to be written
1241  ea_type& m_ea;
1242 
1243 #ifndef NDEBUG
1244  //! total number of iterators referencing this writer
1245  unsigned int m_ref_total;
1246 #endif
1247 
1248  //! reference counters for the number of live iterators on the
1249  //! corresponding block in external_array.
1250  std::vector<unsigned int> m_ref_count;
1251 
1252  //! mutex for reference counting array (this is actually nicer than
1253  //! openmp's critical)
1254  mutex m_mutex;
1255 
1256  //! optimization: hold live iterators for the expected boundary blocks of
1257  //! multiway_merge().
1258  std::vector<iterator> m_live_boundary;
1259 
1260 protected:
1261  //! read block into memory and increase reference count (called when an
1262  //! iterator goes live on the block).
1263  block_type * get_block_ref(size_t block_index)
1264  {
1265  scoped_mutex_lock lock(m_mutex);
1266 
1267  assert(block_index < m_ea.num_blocks());
1268  unsigned int ref = m_ref_count[block_index]++;
1269 #ifndef NDEBUG
1270  ++m_ref_total;
1271 #endif
1272 
1273  if (ref == 0) {
1274  STXXL_DEBUG("get_block_ref block_index=" << block_index <<
1275  " ref=" << ref << " reading.");
1276  m_ea.read_block(block_index);
1277  }
1278  else {
1279  STXXL_DEBUG("get_block_ref block_index=" << block_index <<
1280  " ref=" << ref);
1281  }
1282 
1283  return m_ea.m_blocks[block_index];
1284  }
1285 
1286  //! decrease reference count on the block, and possibly write it to disk
1287  //! (called when an iterator releases live mode).
1288  void free_block_ref(size_t block_index)
1289  {
1290  scoped_mutex_lock lock(m_mutex);
1291 
1292  assert(block_index < m_ea.num_blocks());
1293 #ifndef NDEBUG
1294  assert(m_ref_total > 0);
1295  --m_ref_total;
1296 #endif
1297  unsigned int ref = --m_ref_count[block_index];
1298 
1299  if (ref == 0) {
1300  STXXL_DEBUG("free_block_ref block_index=" << block_index <<
1301  " ref=" << ref << " written.");
1302  m_ea.write_block(block_index);
1303  }
1304  else {
1305  STXXL_DEBUG("free_block_ref block_index=" << block_index <<
1306  " ref=" << ref);
1307  }
1308  }
1309 
1310  //! allow access to the block_ref functions
1311  friend class iterator;
1312 
1313 public:
1314  /**
1315  * An iterator which can be used to write (and read) an external_array via
1316  * an external_array_writer. See the documentation of external_array_writer.
1317  */
1318  class iterator
1319  {
1320  public:
1321  typedef external_array_writer writer_type;
1322  typedef ExternalArrayType ea_type;
1323 
1324  typedef typename ea_type::value_type value_type;
1325  typedef value_type& reference;
1326  typedef value_type* pointer;
1327  typedef ptrdiff_t difference_type;
1328  typedef std::random_access_iterator_tag iterator_category;
1329 
1330  typedef iterator self_type;
1331 
1332  static const size_t block_items = ea_type::block_items;
1333 
1334  //! scope based debug variable
1335  static const bool debug = false;
1336 
1337  protected:
1338  //! pointer to the external array containing the elements
1339  writer_type* m_writer;
1340 
1341  //! when operator* or operator-> are called, then the iterator goes
1342  //! live and allocates a reference to the block's data (possibly
1343  //! reading it from EM).
1344  bool m_live;
1345 
1346  //! index of the current element, absolute in the external array
1347  external_size_type m_index;
1348 
1349  //! index of the current element's block in the external array's block
1350  //! list. undefined while m_live is false.
1351  internal_size_type m_block_index;
1352 
1353  //! pointer to the referenced block. undefined while m_live is false.
1354  block_type* m_block;
1355 
1356  //! pointer to the current element inside the referenced block.
1357  //! undefined while m_live is false.
1358  internal_size_type m_current;
1359 
1360  public:
1361  //! default constructor (should not be used directly)
1362  iterator()
1363  : m_writer(NULL), m_live(false), m_index(0)
1364  { }
1365 
1366  //! construct a new iterator
1367  iterator(writer_type* writer, external_size_type index)
1368  : m_writer(writer),
1369  m_live(false),
1370  m_index(index)
1371  {
1372  STXXL_DEBUG("Construct iterator for index " << m_index);
1373  }
1374 
1375  //! copy an iterator, the new iterator is _not_ automatically live!
1376  iterator(const iterator& other)
1377  : m_writer(other.m_writer),
1378  m_live(false),
1379  m_index(other.m_index)
1380  {
1381  STXXL_DEBUG("Copy-Construct iterator for index " << m_index);
1382  }
1383 
1384  //! assign an iterator, the assigned iterator is not automatically live!
1385  iterator& operator = (const iterator& other)
1386  {
1387  if (&other != this)
1388  {
1389  STXXL_DEBUG("Assign iterator to index " << other.m_index);
1390 
1391  if (m_live)
1392  m_writer->free_block_ref(m_block_index);
1393 
1394  m_writer = other.m_writer;
1395  m_live = false;
1396  m_index = other.m_index;
1397  }
1398 
1399  return *this;
1400  }
1401 
1402  ~iterator()
1403  {
1404  if (!m_live) return; // no need for cleanup
1405 
1406  m_writer->free_block_ref(m_block_index);
1407 
1408  STXXL_DEBUG("Destruction of iterator for index " << m_index <<
1409  " in block " << m_index / block_items);
1410  }
1411 
1412  //! return the current absolute index inside the external array.
1413  external_size_type get_index() const
1414  {
1415  return m_index;
1416  }
1417 
1418  //! allocates a reference to the block's data (possibly reading it from
1419  //! EM).
1420  void make_live()
1421  {
1422  assert(!m_live);
1423 
1424  // calculate block and index inside
1425  m_block_index = m_index / block_items;
1426  m_current = m_index % block_items;
1427 
1428  STXXL_DEBUG("operator*() live request for index=" << m_index <<
1429  " block_index=" << m_block_index <<
1430  " m_current=" << m_current);
1431 
1432  // get block reference
1433  m_block = m_writer->get_block_ref(m_block_index);
1434  m_live = true;
1435  }
1436 
1437  //! access the current item
1438  reference operator * ()
1439  {
1440  if (UNLIKELY(!m_live))
1441  make_live();
1442 
1443  return (*m_block)[m_current];
1444  }
1445 
1446  //! access the current item
1447  pointer operator -> ()
1448  {
1449  return &(operator * ());
1450  }
1451 
1452  //! prefix-increment operator
1453  self_type& operator ++ ()
1454  {
1455  ++m_index;
1456  if (UNLIKELY(!m_live)) return *this;
1457 
1458  // if index stays in the same block, everything is fine
1459  ++m_current;
1460  if (LIKELY(m_current != block_items)) return *this;
1461 
1462  // release current block
1463  m_writer->free_block_ref(m_block_index);
1464  m_live = false;
1465 
1466  return *this;
1467  }
1468 
1469  self_type operator + (difference_type addend) const
1470  {
1471  return self_type(m_writer, m_index + addend);
1472  }
1473  self_type operator - (difference_type subtrahend) const
1474  {
1475  return self_type(m_writer, m_index - subtrahend);
1476  }
1477  difference_type operator - (const self_type& o) const
1478  {
1479  return (m_index - o.m_index);
1480  }
1481 
1482  bool operator == (const self_type& o) const
1483  {
1484  return m_index == o.m_index;
1485  }
1486  bool operator != (const self_type& o) const
1487  {
1488  return m_index != o.m_index;
1489  }
1490  bool operator < (const self_type& o) const
1491  {
1492  return m_index < o.m_index;
1493  }
1494  bool operator <= (const self_type& o) const
1495  {
1496  return m_index <= o.m_index;
1497  }
1498  bool operator > (const self_type& o) const
1499  {
1500  return m_index > o.m_index;
1501  }
1502  bool operator >= (const self_type& o) const
1503  {
1504  return m_index >= o.m_index;
1505  }
1506  };
1507 
1508 public:
1509  external_array_writer(ea_type& ea, unsigned int num_threads = 0)
1510  : m_ea(ea),
1511  m_ref_count(ea.num_blocks(), 0)
1512  {
1513 #ifndef NDEBUG
1514  m_ref_total = 0;
1515 #endif
1516 
1517 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
1518  if (num_threads == 0)
1519  num_threads = omp_get_max_threads();
1520 #else
1521  if (num_threads == 0)
1522  num_threads = 1;
1523 #endif
1524 
1525  m_ea.prepare_write(num_threads);
1526 
1527  // optimization: hold live iterators for the boundary blocks which two
1528  // threads write to. this prohibits the blocks to be written to disk
1529  // and read again.
1530 
1531  double step = (double)m_ea.capacity() / (double)num_threads;
1532  m_live_boundary.resize(num_threads - 1);
1533 
1534  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_threads - 1; ++i)
1535  {
1536  external_size_type index = (external_size_type)((i + 1) * step);
1537  STXXL_DEBUG("hold index " << index <<
1538  " in block " << index / ea_type::block_items);
1539  m_live_boundary[i] = iterator(this, index);
1540  m_live_boundary[i].make_live();
1541  }
1542  }
1543 
1544  ~external_array_writer()
1545  {
1546  m_live_boundary.clear(); // release block boundaries
1547 #ifndef NDEBUG
1548  STXXL_ASSERT(m_ref_total == 0);
1549 #endif
1550  m_ea.finish_write();
1551  }
1552 
1553  iterator begin()
1554  {
1555  return iterator(this, 0);
1556  }
1557 
1558  iterator end()
1559  {
1560  return iterator(this, m_ea.capacity());
1561  }
1562 };
1563 
1564 /*!
1565  * The minima_tree contains minima from all sources inside the PPQ. It contains
1566  * four substructures: winner trees for insertion heaps, internal and external
1567  * arrays, each containing the minima from all currently allocated
1568  * structures. These three sources, plus the deletion buffer are combined using
1569  * a "head" inner tree containing only up to four item.
1570  */
1571 template <class ParentType>
1572 class minima_tree
1573 {
1574 public:
1575  typedef ParentType parent_type;
1576  typedef minima_tree<ParentType> self_type;
1577 
1578  typedef typename parent_type::inv_compare_type compare_type;
1579  typedef typename parent_type::value_type value_type;
1580  typedef typename parent_type::proc_vector_type proc_vector_type;
1581  typedef typename parent_type::internal_arrays_type ias_type;
1582  typedef typename parent_type::external_arrays_type eas_type;
1583 
1584  static const unsigned initial_ia_size = 2;
1585  static const unsigned initial_ea_size = 2;
1586 
1587 protected:
1588  //! WinnerTree-Comparator for the head winner tree. It accesses all
1589  //! relevant data structures from the priority queue.
1590  struct head_comp
1591  {
1592  self_type& m_parent;
1593  proc_vector_type& m_proc;
1594  ias_type& m_ias;
1595  const compare_type& m_compare;
1596 
1597  head_comp(self_type& parent, proc_vector_type& proc,
1598  ias_type& ias, const compare_type& compare)
1599  : m_parent(parent),
1600  m_proc(proc),
1601  m_ias(ias),
1602  m_compare(compare)
1603  { }
1604 
1605  const value_type & get_value(int input) const
1606  {
1607  switch (input) {
1608  case HEAP:
1609  return m_proc[m_parent.m_heaps.top()]->insertion_heap[0];
1610  case IA:
1611  return m_ias[m_parent.m_ia.top()].get_min();
1612  case EB:
1613  return m_parent.m_parent.m_extract_buffer[
1614  m_parent.m_parent.m_extract_buffer_index
1615  ];
1616  default:
1617  abort();
1618  }
1619  }
1620 
1621  bool operator () (const int a, const int b) const
1622  {
1623  return m_compare(get_value(a), get_value(b));
1624  }
1625  };
1626 
1627  //! Comparator for the insertion heaps winner tree.
1628  struct heaps_comp
1629  {
1630  proc_vector_type& m_proc;
1631  const compare_type& m_compare;
1632 
1633  heaps_comp(proc_vector_type& proc, const compare_type& compare)
1634  : m_proc(proc), m_compare(compare)
1635  { }
1636 
1637  const value_type & get_value(int index) const
1638  {
1639  return m_proc[index]->insertion_heap[0];
1640  }
1641 
1642  bool operator () (const int a, const int b) const
1643  {
1644  return m_compare(get_value(a), get_value(b));
1645  }
1646  };
1647 
1648  //! Comparator for the internal arrays winner tree.
1649  struct ia_comp
1650  {
1651  ias_type& m_ias;
1652  const compare_type& m_compare;
1653 
1654  ia_comp(ias_type& ias, const compare_type& compare)
1655  : m_ias(ias), m_compare(compare)
1656  { }
1657 
1658  bool operator () (const int a, const int b) const
1659  {
1660  return m_compare(m_ias[a].get_min(), m_ias[b].get_min());
1661  }
1662  };
1663 
1664 protected:
1665  //! The priority queue
1666  parent_type& m_parent;
1667 
1668  //! value_type comparator
1669  const compare_type& m_compare;
1670 
1671  //! Comperator instances
1672  head_comp m_head_comp;
1673  heaps_comp m_heaps_comp;
1674  ia_comp m_ia_comp;
1675 
1676  //! The winner trees
1677  winner_tree<head_comp> m_head;
1678  winner_tree<heaps_comp> m_heaps;
1679  winner_tree<ia_comp> m_ia;
1680 
1681 public:
1682  //! Entries in the head winner tree.
1683  enum Types {
1684  HEAP = 0,
1685  IA = 1,
1686  EB = 2,
1687  ERROR = 3
1688  };
1689 
1690  //! Construct the tree of minima sources.
1691  minima_tree(parent_type& parent)
1692  : m_parent(parent),
1693  m_compare(parent.m_inv_compare),
1694  // construct comparators
1695  m_head_comp(*this, parent.m_proc,
1696  parent.m_internal_arrays, m_compare),
1697  m_heaps_comp(parent.m_proc, m_compare),
1698  m_ia_comp(parent.m_internal_arrays, m_compare),
1699  // construct header winner tree
1700  m_head(3, m_head_comp),
1701  m_heaps(m_parent.m_num_insertion_heaps, m_heaps_comp),
1702  m_ia(initial_ia_size, m_ia_comp)
1703  { }
1704 
1705  //! Return smallest items of head winner tree.
1706  std::pair<unsigned, unsigned> top()
1707  {
1708  unsigned type = m_head.top();
1709  switch (type)
1710  {
1711  case HEAP:
1712  return std::make_pair(HEAP, m_heaps.top());
1713  case IA:
1714  return std::make_pair(IA, m_ia.top());
1715  case EB:
1716  return std::make_pair(EB, 0);
1717  default:
1718  return std::make_pair(ERROR, 0);
1719  }
1720  }
1721 
1722  //! Update minima tree after an item from the heap index was removed.
1723  void update_heap(unsigned index)
1724  {
1725  m_heaps.notify_change(index);
1726  m_head.notify_change(HEAP);
1727  }
1728 
1729  //! Update minima tree after an item of the extract buffer was removed.
1730  void update_extract_buffer()
1731  {
1732  m_head.notify_change(EB);
1733  }
1734 
1735  //! Update minima tree after an item from an internal array was removed.
1736  void update_internal_array(unsigned index)
1737  {
1738  m_ia.notify_change(index);
1739  m_head.notify_change(IA);
1740  }
1741 
1742  //! Add a newly created internal array to the minima tree.
1743  void add_internal_array(unsigned index)
1744  {
1745  m_ia.activate_player(index);
1746  m_head.notify_change(IA);
1747  }
1748 
1749  //! Remove an insertion heap from the minima tree.
1750  void deactivate_heap(unsigned index)
1751  {
1752  m_heaps.deactivate_player(index);
1753  if (!m_heaps.empty())
1754  m_head.notify_change(HEAP);
1755  else
1756  m_head.deactivate_player(HEAP);
1757  }
1758 
1759  //! Remove the extract buffer from the minima tree.
1760  void deactivate_extract_buffer()
1761  {
1762  m_head.deactivate_player(EB);
1763  }
1764 
1765  //! Remove an internal array from the minima tree.
1766  void deactivate_internal_array(unsigned index)
1767  {
1768  m_ia.deactivate_player(index);
1769  if (!m_ia.empty())
1770  m_head.notify_change(IA);
1771  else
1772  m_head.deactivate_player(IA);
1773  }
1774 
1775  //! Remove all insertion heaps from the minima tree.
1776  void clear_heaps()
1777  {
1778  m_heaps.clear();
1779  m_head.deactivate_player(HEAP);
1780  }
1781 
1782  //! Remove all internal arrays from the minima tree.
1783  void clear_internal_arrays()
1784  {
1785  m_ia.resize_and_clear(initial_ia_size);
1786  m_head.deactivate_player(IA);
1787  }
1788 
1789  void rebuild_internal_arrays()
1790  {
1791  m_ia.resize_and_rebuild(m_parent.m_internal_arrays.size());
1792  if (!m_parent.m_internal_arrays.empty())
1793  m_head.notify_change(IA);
1794  else
1795  m_head.deactivate_player(IA);
1796  }
1797 
1798  //! Return size of internal arrays minima tree
1799  size_t ia_slots() const
1800  {
1801  return m_ia.num_slots();
1802  }
1803 
1804  //! Returns a readable representation of the winner tree as string.
1805  std::string to_string() const
1806  {
1807  std::ostringstream ss;
1808  ss << "Head:" << std::endl << m_head.to_string() << std::endl;
1809  ss << "Heaps:" << std::endl << m_heaps.to_string() << std::endl;
1810  ss << "IA:" << std::endl << m_ia.to_string() << std::endl;
1811  return ss.str();
1812  }
1813 
1814  //! Prints statistical data.
1815  void print_stats() const
1816  {
1817  STXXL_MSG("Head winner tree stats:");
1818  m_head.print_stats();
1819  STXXL_MSG("Heaps winner tree stats:");
1820  m_heaps.print_stats();
1821  STXXL_MSG("IA winner tree stats:");
1822  m_ia.print_stats();
1823  }
1824 };
1825 
1826 } // namespace ppq_local
1827 
1828 /*!
1829  * Parallelized External Memory Priority Queue.
1830  *
1831  * \tparam ValueType Type of the contained objects (POD with no references to
1832  * internal memory).
1833  *
1834  * \tparam CompareType The comparator type used to determine whether one
1835  * element is smaller than another element.
1836  *
1837  * \tparam DefaultMemSize Maximum memory consumption by the queue. Can be
1838  * overwritten by the constructor. Default = 1 GiB.
1839  *
1840  * \tparam MaxItems Maximum number of elements the queue contains at one
1841  * time. Default = 0 = unlimited. This is no hard limit and only used for
1842  * optimization. Can be overwritten by the constructor.
1843  *
1844  * \tparam BlockSize External block size. Default =
1845  * STXXL_DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE(ValueType).
1846  *
1847  * \tparam AllocStrategy Allocation strategy for the external memory. Default =
1848  * STXXL_DEFAULT_ALLOC_STRATEGY.
1849  */
1850 template <
1851  class ValueType,
1852  class CompareType = std::less<ValueType>,
1853  class AllocStrategy = STXXL_DEFAULT_ALLOC_STRATEGY,
1854  uint64 BlockSize = STXXL_DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE(ValueType),
1855  uint64 DefaultMemSize = 1* 1024L* 1024L* 1024L,
1856  uint64 MaxItems = 0
1857  >
1858 class parallel_priority_queue : private noncopyable
1859 {
1860  //! \name Types
1861  //! \{
1862 
1863 public:
1864  typedef ValueType value_type;
1865  typedef CompareType compare_type;
1866  typedef AllocStrategy alloc_strategy;
1867  static const uint64 block_size = BlockSize;
1868  typedef uint64 size_type;
1869 
1870  typedef typed_block<block_size, value_type> block_type;
1871  typedef std::vector<BID<block_size> > bid_vector;
1872  typedef bid_vector bids_container_type;
1873  typedef read_write_pool<block_type> pool_type;
1874  typedef ppq_local::internal_array<value_type> internal_array_type;
1875  typedef ppq_local::external_array<value_type, block_size, AllocStrategy> external_array_type;
1876  typedef typename external_array_type::writer_type external_array_writer_type;
1877  typedef typename std::vector<value_type>::iterator value_iterator;
1878  typedef typename internal_array_type::iterator iterator;
1879  typedef std::pair<iterator, iterator> iterator_pair_type;
1880 
1881  static const bool debug = false;
1882 
1883  //! currently global public tuning parameter:
1884  unsigned_type c_max_internal_level_size;
1885 
1886  //! currently global public tuning parameter:
1887  unsigned_type c_max_external_level_size;
1888 
1889 protected:
1890  //! type of insertion heap itself
1891  typedef std::vector<value_type> heap_type;
1892 
1893  //! type of internal arrays vector
1894  typedef typename stxxl::swap_vector<internal_array_type> internal_arrays_type;
1895  //! type of external arrays vector
1896  typedef typename stxxl::swap_vector<external_array_type> external_arrays_type;
1897  //! type of minima tree combining the structures
1898  typedef ppq_local::minima_tree<
1899  parallel_priority_queue<value_type, compare_type, alloc_strategy,
1900  block_size, DefaultMemSize, MaxItems> > minima_type;
1901  //! allow minima tree access to internal data structures
1902  friend class ppq_local::minima_tree<
1903  parallel_priority_queue<value_type, compare_type, alloc_strategy,
1904  block_size, DefaultMemSize, MaxItems> >;
1905 
1906  //! Inverse comparison functor
1907  struct inv_compare_type
1908  {
1909  const compare_type& compare;
1910 
1911  inv_compare_type(const compare_type& c)
1912  : compare(c)
1913  { }
1914 
1915  bool operator () (const value_type& x, const value_type& y) const
1916  {
1917  return compare(y, x);
1918  }
1919  };
1920 
1921  //! <-Comparator for value_type
1922  compare_type m_compare;
1923 
1924  //! >-Comparator for value_type
1925  inv_compare_type m_inv_compare;
1926 
1927  //! Defines if statistics are gathered: dummy_custom_stats_counter or
1928  //! custom_stats_counter
1929  typedef dummy_custom_stats_counter<uint64> stats_counter;
1930 
1931  //! Defines if statistics are gathered: fake_timer or timer
1932  typedef fake_timer stats_timer;
1933 
1934  //! \}
1935 
1936  //! \name Compile-Time Parameters
1937  //! \{
1938 
1939  //! Merge sorted heaps when flushing into an internal array.
1940  //! Pro: Reduces the risk of a large winner tree
1941  //! Con: Flush insertion heaps becomes slower.
1942  static const bool c_merge_sorted_heaps = true;
1943 
1944  //! Default number of write buffer block for a new external array being
1945  //! filled.
1946  static const unsigned c_num_write_buffer_blocks = 14;
1947 
1948  //! Defines for how much external arrays memory should be reserved in the
1949  //! constructor.
1950  static const unsigned c_num_reserved_external_arrays = 10;
1951 
1952  //! Size of a single insertion heap in Byte, if not defined otherwise in
1953  //! the constructor. Default: 1 MiB
1954  static const size_type c_default_single_heap_ram = 1L * 1024L * 1024L;
1955 
1956  //! Default limit of the extract buffer ram consumption as share of total
1957  //! ram
1958  // C++11: constexpr static double c_default_extract_buffer_ram_part = 0.05;
1959  // C++98 does not allow static const double initialization here.
1960  // It's located in global scope instead.
1961  static const double c_default_extract_buffer_ram_part;
1962 
1963  /*!
1964  * Limit the size of the extract buffer to an absolute value.
1965  *
1966  * The actual size can be set using the extract_buffer_ram parameter of the
1967  * constructor. If this parameter is not set, the value is calculated by
1968  * (total_ram*c_default_extract_buffer_ram_part)
1969  *
1970  * If c_limit_extract_buffer==false, the memory consumption of the extract
1971  * buffer is only limited by the number of external and internal
1972  * arrays. This is considered in memory management using the
1973  * ram_per_external_array and ram_per_internal_array values. Attention:
1974  * Each internal array reserves space for the extract buffer in the size of
1975  * all heaps together.
1976  */
1977  static const bool c_limit_extract_buffer = true;
1978 
1979  //! For bulks of size up to c_single_insert_limit sequential single insert
1980  //! is faster than bulk_push.
1981  static const unsigned c_single_insert_limit = 100;
1982 
1983  //! \}
1984 
1985  //! \name Parameters and Sizes for Memory Allocation Policy
1986 
1987  //! Number of insertion heaps. Usually equal to the number of CPUs.
1988  const unsigned m_num_insertion_heaps;
1989 
1990  //! Capacity of one inserion heap
1991  const unsigned m_insertion_heap_capacity;
1992 
1993  //! Return size of insertion heap reservation in bytes
1994  size_type insertion_heap_int_memory() const
1995  {
1996  return m_insertion_heap_capacity * sizeof(value_type);
1997  }
1998 
1999  //! Total amount of internal memory
2000  const size_type m_mem_total;
2001 
2002  //! Maximum size of extract buffer in number of elements
2003  //! Only relevant if c_limit_extract_buffer==true
2004  size_type m_extract_buffer_limit;
2005 
2006  //! Size of all insertion heaps together in bytes
2007  const size_type m_mem_for_heaps;
2008 
2009  //! Number of read/prefetch blocks per external array.
2010  const float m_num_read_blocks_per_ea;
2011 
2012  //! Total number of read/prefetch buffer blocks
2013  unsigned_type m_num_read_blocks;
2014  //! number of currently hinted prefetch blocks
2015  unsigned_type m_num_hinted_blocks;
2016  //! number of currently loaded blocks
2017  unsigned_type m_num_used_read_blocks;
2018 
2019  //! Free memory in bytes
2020  size_type m_mem_left;
2021 
2022  //! \}
2023 
2024  //! Flag if inside a bulk_push sequence.
2025  bool m_in_bulk_push;
2026 
2027  //! If the bulk currently being inserted is very large, this boolean is set
2028  //! and bulk_push just accumulate the elements for eventual sorting.
2029  bool m_is_very_large_bulk;
2030 
2031  //! First index in m_external_arrays that was not re-hinted during a
2032  //! bulk_push sequence.
2033  unsigned_type m_bulk_first_delayed_external_array;
2034 
2035  //! Index of the currently smallest element in the extract buffer
2036  size_type m_extract_buffer_index;
2037 
2038  //! \name Number of elements currently in the data structures
2039  //! \{
2040 
2041  //! Number of elements int the insertion heaps
2042  size_type m_heaps_size;
2043 
2044  //! Number of elements in the extract buffer
2045  size_type m_extract_buffer_size;
2046

2108  //! Compares the largest accessible value of two external arrays.
2109  struct external_min_comparator {
2110  const external_arrays_type& m_eas;
2111  const inv_compare_type& m_compare;
2112 
2113  external_min_comparator(const external_arrays_type& eas,
2114  const inv_compare_type& compare)
2115  : m_eas(eas), m_compare(compare) { }
2116 
2117  bool operator () (const size_t& a, const size_t& b) const
2118  {
2119  return m_compare(m_eas[a].get_next_block_min(),
2120  m_eas[b].get_next_block_min());
2121  }
2122  } m_external_min_comparator;

2124  //! Tracks the largest accessible values of the external arrays if there

2126  //! needs to fetch further data from EM. Used in calculate_merge_sequences.
2127  winner_tree<external_min_comparator> m_external_min_tree;
2128

2142  m_eas[b].get_next_hintable_min());
2143  }
2144  } m_hint_comparator;
2145 
2146  //! Tracks the largest values of the block hinted the latest of the

2148  //! array is the first one that needs to fetch further data from EM.

2162  //! Unary operator which returns true if the external array has run empty.

2165  { return a.empty(); }
2166  };

2168  //! Unary operator which returns true if the internal array has run empty.

2171  { return a.empty(); }

2174  //! Clean up empty internal arrays, free their memory and capacity
2175  void cleanup_internal_arrays()
2176  {
2177  typename internal_arrays_type::iterator swap_end =
2178  stxxl::swap_remove_if(m_internal_arrays.begin(),
2179  m_internal_arrays.end(),
2180  empty_internal_array_eraser());
2181 
2182  for (typename internal_arrays_type::iterator ia = swap_end;
2183  ia != m_internal_arrays.end(); ++ia)
2184  {
2185  m_mem_left += ia->int_memory();
2186  --m_internal_levels[ia->level()];
2187  }
2188 
2189  if (swap_end != m_internal_arrays.end())
2190  STXXL_DEBUG0("cleanup_internal_arrays" <<
2191  " cleaned=" << m_internal_arrays.end() - swap_end);
2192 
2193  m_internal_arrays.erase(swap_end, m_internal_arrays.end());
2194  m_minima.rebuild_internal_arrays();
2195  }
2196 
2197  //! Clean up empty external arrays, free their memory and capacity
2198  void cleanup_external_arrays()
2199  {
2200  typedef typename external_arrays_type::iterator ea_iterator;
2201  empty_external_array_eraser pred;
2202 
2203  // The following is a modified implementation of swap_remove_if().
2204  // Updates m_external_min_tree accordingly.
2205 
2206  ea_iterator first = m_external_arrays.begin();
2207  ea_iterator last = m_external_arrays.end();
2208  ea_iterator swap_end = first;
2209  size_t size = m_external_arrays.end() - m_external_arrays.begin();
2210  size_t first_removed = size;
2211  while (first != last)
2212  {
2213  if (!pred(*first))
2214  {
2215  using std::swap;
2216  swap(*first, *swap_end);
2217  ++swap_end;
2218  }
2219  else if (first_removed >= size)
2220  {
2221  first_removed = first - m_external_arrays.begin();
2222  }
2223  ++first;
2224  }
2225 
2226  // subtract memory of EAs, which will be freed
2227  for (ea_iterator ea = swap_end; ea != last; ++ea) {
2228  m_mem_left += ea->int_memory();
2229  --m_external_levels[ea->level()];
2230  }
2231 
2232  size_t swap_end_index = swap_end - m_external_arrays.begin();
2233 
2234  // Deactivating all affected players first.
2235  // Otherwise there might be outdated comparisons.
2236  for (size_t i = size; i != first_removed; ) {
2237  --i;
2238  m_external_min_tree.deactivate_player_step(i);
2239  // TODO delay if (m_in_bulk_push)?
2240  m_hint_tree.deactivate_player_step(i);
2241  }
2242 
2243  // Replay moved arrays.
2244  for (size_t i = first_removed; i < swap_end_index; ++i) {
2245  update_external_min_tree(i);
2246  // TODO delay if (m_in_bulk_push)?
2247  update_hint_tree(i);
2248  }
2249 
2250  STXXL_DEBUG("Removed " << m_external_arrays.end() - swap_end <<
2251  " empty external arrays.");
2252 
2253  m_external_arrays.erase(swap_end, m_external_arrays.end());
2254 
2255  resize_read_pool(); // shrinks read/prefetch pool
2256  }
2257 
2258  /*!
2259  * SiftUp a new element from the last position in the heap, reestablishing
2260  * the heap invariant. This is identical to std::push_heap, except that it
2261  * returns the last element modified by siftUp. Thus we can identify if the
2262  * minimum may have changed.
2263  */
2264  template <typename RandomAccessIterator, typename HeapCompareType>
2265  static inline unsigned_type
2266  push_heap(RandomAccessIterator first, RandomAccessIterator last,
2267  HeapCompareType comp)
2268  {
2269  typedef typename std::iterator_traits<RandomAccessIterator>::value_type
2270  value_type;
2271 
2272  value_type value = _GLIBCXX_MOVE(*(last - 1));
2273 
2274  unsigned_type index = (last - first) - 1;
2275  unsigned_type parent = (index - 1) / 2;
2276 
2277  while (index > 0 && comp(*(first + parent), value))
2278  {
2279  *(first + index) = _GLIBCXX_MOVE(*(first + parent));
2280  index = parent;
2281  parent = (index - 1) / 2;
2282  }
2283  *(first + index) = _GLIBCXX_MOVE(value);
2284 
2285  return index;
2286  }
2287 
2288 public:
2289  //! \name Initialization
2290  //! \{
2291 
2292  /*!
2293  * Constructor.
2294  *
2295  * \param compare Comparator for priority queue, which is a Max-PQ.
2296  *
2297  * \param total_ram Maximum RAM usage. 0 = Default = Use the template
2298  * value DefaultMemSize.
2299  *
2300  * \param num_read_blocks_per_ea Number of read blocks per external
2301  * array. Default = 1.5f
2302  *
2303  * \param num_write_buffer_blocks Number of write buffer blocks for a new
2304  * external array being filled. 0 = Default = c_num_write_buffer_blocks
2305  *
2306  * \param num_insertion_heaps Number of insertion heaps. 0 = Default =
2307  * Determine by omp_get_max_threads().
2308  *
2309  * \param single_heap_ram Memory usage for a single insertion heap.
2310  * Default = c_single_heap_ram.
2311  *
2312  * \param extract_buffer_ram Memory usage for the extract buffer. Only
2313  * relevant if c_limit_extract_buffer==true. 0 = Default = total_ram *
2314  * c_default_extract_buffer_ram_part.
2315  */
2316  parallel_priority_queue(
2317  const compare_type& compare = compare_type(),
2318  size_type total_ram = DefaultMemSize,
2319  float num_read_blocks_per_ea = 1.5f,
2320  unsigned_type num_write_buffer_blocks = c_num_write_buffer_blocks,
2321  unsigned_type num_insertion_heaps = 0,
2322  size_type single_heap_ram = c_default_single_heap_ram,
2323  size_type extract_buffer_ram = 0)
2324  : c_max_internal_level_size(64),
2325  c_max_external_level_size(64),
2326  m_compare(compare),
2327  m_inv_compare(m_compare),
2328  // Parameters and Sizes for Memory Allocation Policy
2329 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
2330  m_num_insertion_heaps(num_insertion_heaps > 0 ? num_insertion_heaps : omp_get_max_threads()),
2331 #else
2332  m_num_insertion_heaps(num_insertion_heaps > 0 ? num_insertion_heaps : 1),
2333 #endif
2334  m_insertion_heap_capacity(single_heap_ram / sizeof(value_type)),
2335  m_mem_total(total_ram),
2336  m_mem_for_heaps(m_num_insertion_heaps * single_heap_ram),
2337  m_num_read_blocks_per_ea(num_read_blocks_per_ea),
2338  m_num_read_blocks(0),
2339  m_num_hinted_blocks(0),
2340  m_num_used_read_blocks(0),
2341  // (unnamed)
2342  m_in_bulk_push(false),
2343  m_is_very_large_bulk(false),
2344  m_extract_buffer_index(0),
2345  // Number of elements currently in the data structures
2346  m_heaps_size(0),
2347  m_extract_buffer_size(0),
2348  m_internal_size(0),
2349  m_external_size(0),
2350  // Data Holding Structures
2351  m_proc(m_num_insertion_heaps),
2352  m_pool(0, num_write_buffer_blocks),
2353  m_external_arrays(),
2354  m_minima(*this),
2355  m_external_min_comparator(m_external_arrays, m_inv_compare),
2356  m_external_min_tree(4, m_external_min_comparator),
2357  m_hint_comparator(m_external_arrays, m_inv_compare),
2358  m_hint_tree(4, m_hint_comparator),
2359  // flags
2360  m_limit_extract(false)
2361  {
2362 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
2363  if (!omp_get_nested()) {
2364  omp_set_nested(1);
2365  if (!omp_get_nested()) {
2366  STXXL_ERRMSG("Could not enable OpenMP's nested parallelism, "
2367  "however, the PPQ requires this OpenMP feature.");
2368  abort();
2369  }
2370  }
2371 #else
2372  STXXL_ERRMSG("You are using stxxl::parallel_priority_queue without "
2373  "support for OpenMP parallelism.");
2374  STXXL_ERRMSG("This is probably not what you want, so check the "
2375  "compilation settings.");
2376 #endif
2377 
2378  if (c_limit_extract_buffer) {
2379  m_extract_buffer_limit = (extract_buffer_ram > 0)
2380  ? extract_buffer_ram / sizeof(value_type)
2381  : static_cast<size_type>(((double)(m_mem_total) * c_default_extract_buffer_ram_part / sizeof(value_type)));
2382  }
2383 
2384  for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < c_max_internal_levels; ++i)
2385  m_internal_levels[i] = 0;
2386 
2387  for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < c_max_external_levels; ++i)
2388  m_external_levels[i] = 0;
2389 
2390  // TODO: Do we still need this line? Insertion heap memory is
2391  // registered below. And merge buffer is equal to the new IA...
2392  // total_ram - ram for the heaps - ram for the heap merger
2393  m_mem_left = m_mem_total - 2 * m_mem_for_heaps;
2394 
2395  // reverse insertion heap memory on processor-local memory
2396 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
2397 #pragma omp parallel for
2398 #endif
2399  for (size_t p = 0; p < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++p)
2400  {
2401  m_proc[p] = new ProcessorData;
2402  m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.reserve(m_insertion_heap_capacity);
2403  assert(m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.capacity() * sizeof(value_type)
2404  == insertion_heap_int_memory());
2405  }
2406 
2407  m_mem_left -= m_num_insertion_heaps * insertion_heap_int_memory();
2408 
2409  // prepare prefetch buffer pool (already done in initializer),
2410  // initially zero.
2411 
2412  // prepare write buffer pool: calculate size and subtract from mem_left
2413  external_array_type::prepare_write_pool(m_pool, m_num_insertion_heaps);
2414  m_mem_left -= m_pool.size_write() * block_size;
2415 
2416  // prepare internal arrays
2417  if (c_merge_sorted_heaps) {
2418  m_internal_arrays.reserve(m_mem_total / m_mem_for_heaps);
2419  }
2420  else {
2421  m_internal_arrays.reserve(m_mem_total * m_num_insertion_heaps / m_mem_for_heaps);
2422  }
2423 
2424  // prepare external arrays
2425  m_external_arrays.reserve(c_num_reserved_external_arrays);
2426 
2427  if (m_mem_total < m_mem_left) // checks if unsigned type wrapped.
2428  {
2429  STXXL_ERRMSG("Minimum memory requirement insufficient, "
2430  "increase PPQ's memory limit or decrease buffers.");
2431  abort();
2432  }
2433 
2434  check_invariants();
2435  }
2436 
2437  //! Destructor.
2438  ~parallel_priority_queue()
2439  {
2440  // clean up data structures
2441 
2442  for (size_t p = 0; p < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++p)
2443  {
2444  delete m_proc[p];
2445  }
2446  }
2447 
2448 protected:
2449  //! Assert many invariants of the data structures.
2450  void check_invariants() const
2451  {
2452 #ifdef NDEBUG
2453  // disable in Release builds
2454  return;
2455 #endif
2456 
2457  size_type mem_used = 0;
2458 
2459  mem_used += 2 * m_mem_for_heaps
2460  + m_pool.size_write() * block_size
2461  + m_pool.free_size_prefetch() * block_size
2462  + m_num_hinted_blocks * block_size
2463  + m_num_used_read_blocks * block_size;
2464 
2465  // count number of blocks hinted in prefetcher
2466 
2467  size_t num_hinted = 0, num_used_read = 0;
2468  for (size_t i = 0; i < m_external_arrays.size(); ++i) {
2469  num_hinted += m_external_arrays[i].num_hinted_blocks();
2470  num_used_read += m_external_arrays[i].num_used_blocks();
2471  }
2472 
2473  STXXL_CHECK(num_hinted == m_num_hinted_blocks);
2474  STXXL_CHECK(num_used_read == m_num_used_read_blocks);
2475 
2476  STXXL_CHECK_EQUAL(m_num_used_read_blocks,
2477  m_num_read_blocks
2478  - m_pool.free_size_prefetch()
2479  - m_num_hinted_blocks);
2480 
2481  // test the processor local data structures
2482 
2483  size_type heaps_size = 0;
2484 
2485  for (unsigned p = 0; p < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++p)
2486  {
2487  // check that each insertion heap is a heap
2488 
2489  // TODO: remove soon, because this is very expensive
2490  STXXL_CHECK(1 || stxxl::is_heap(m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.begin(),
2491  m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.end(),
2492  m_compare));
2493 
2494  STXXL_CHECK(m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.capacity() <= m_insertion_heap_capacity);
2495 
2496  heaps_size += m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.size();
2497  mem_used += m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.capacity() * sizeof(value_type);
2498  }
2499 
2500  if (!m_in_bulk_push)
2501  STXXL_CHECK_EQUAL(m_heaps_size, heaps_size);
2502 
2503  // count number of items and memory size of internal arrays
2504 
2505  size_type ia_size = 0;
2506  size_type ia_memory = 0;
2507  std::vector<unsigned_type> ia_levels(c_max_internal_levels, 0);
2508 
2509  for (typename internal_arrays_type::const_iterator ia =
2510  m_internal_arrays.begin(); ia != m_internal_arrays.end(); ++ia)
2511  {
2512  ia_size += ia->size();
2513  ia_memory += ia->int_memory();
2514  ++ia_levels[ia->level()];
2515  }
2516 
2517  STXXL_CHECK_EQUAL(m_internal_size, ia_size);
2518  mem_used += ia_memory;
2519 
2520  for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < c_max_internal_levels; ++i)
2521  STXXL_CHECK_EQUAL(m_internal_levels[i], ia_levels[i]);
2522 
2523  // count number of items in external arrays
2524 
2525  size_type ea_size = 0;
2526  size_type ea_memory = 0;
2527  std::vector<unsigned_type> ea_levels(c_max_external_levels, 0);
2528 
2529  for (typename external_arrays_type::const_iterator ea =
2530  m_external_arrays.begin(); ea != m_external_arrays.end(); ++ea)
2531  {
2532  ea_size += ea->size();
2533  ea_memory += ea->int_memory();
2534  ++ea_levels[ea->level()];
2535  }
2536 
2537  STXXL_CHECK_EQUAL(m_external_size, ea_size);
2538  mem_used += ea_memory;
2539 
2540  for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < c_max_external_levels; ++i)
2541  STXXL_CHECK_EQUAL(m_external_levels[i], ea_levels[i]);
2542 
2543  // calculate mem_used so that == mem_total - mem_left
2544 
2545  STXXL_CHECK_EQUAL(memory_consumption(), mem_used);
2546  }
2547 
2548  //! \}
2549 
2550  //! \name Properties
2551  //! \{
2552 
2553 public:
2554  //! The number of elements in the queue.
2555  inline size_type size() const
2556  {
2557  return m_heaps_size + m_internal_size + m_external_size + m_extract_buffer_size;
2558  }
2559 
2560  //! Returns if the queue is empty.
2561  inline bool empty() const
2562  {
2563  return (size() == 0);
2564  }
2565 
2566  //! The memory consumption in Bytes.
2567  inline size_type memory_consumption() const
2568  {
2569  assert(m_mem_total >= m_mem_left);
2570  return (m_mem_total - m_mem_left);
2571  }
2572 
2573 protected:
2574  //! Returns if the extract buffer is empty.
2575  inline bool extract_buffer_empty() const
2576  {
2577  return (m_extract_buffer_size == 0);
2578  }
