2580  //! \}
2581 
2582 public:
2583  //! \name Bulk Operations
2584  //! \{
2585 
2586  /*!
2587  * Start a sequence of push operations.
2588  * \param bulk_size Exact number of elements to push before the next pop.
2589  */
2590  void bulk_push_begin(size_type bulk_size)
2591  {
2592  assert(!m_in_bulk_push);
2593  m_in_bulk_push = true;
2594  m_bulk_first_delayed_external_array = m_external_arrays.size();
2595 
2596  size_type heap_capacity = m_num_insertion_heaps * m_insertion_heap_capacity;
2597 
2598  // if bulk_size is large: use simple aggregation instead of keeping the
2599  // heap property and sort everything afterwards.
2600  if (bulk_size > heap_capacity && 0) {
2601  m_is_very_large_bulk = true;
2602  }
2603  else {
2604  m_is_very_large_bulk = false;
2605 
2606  if (bulk_size + m_heaps_size > heap_capacity) {
2607  if (m_heaps_size > 0) {
2608  //flush_insertion_heaps();
2609  }
2610  }
2611  }
2612 
2613  // zero bulk insertion counters
2614  for (unsigned p = 0; p < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++p)
2615  m_proc[p]->heap_add_size = 0;
2616  }
2617 
2618  /*!
2619  * Push an element inside a sequence of pushes.
2620  * Run bulk_push_begin() before using this method.
2621  *
2622  * \param element The element to push.
2623  * \param p The id of the insertion heap to use (usually the thread id).
2624  */
2625  void bulk_push(const value_type& element, const unsigned_type p)
2626  {
2627  assert(m_in_bulk_push);
2628 
2629  heap_type& insheap = m_proc[p]->insertion_heap;
2630 
2631  if (!m_is_very_large_bulk && 0)
2632  {
2633  // if small bulk: if heap is full -> sort locally and put into
2634  // internal array list. insert items and keep heap invariant.
2635  if (UNLIKELY(insheap.size() >= m_insertion_heap_capacity)) {
2636 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
2637 #pragma omp atomic
2638 #endif
2639  m_heaps_size += m_proc[p]->heap_add_size;
2640 
2641  m_proc[p]->heap_add_size = 0;
2642  flush_insertion_heap(p);
2643  }
2644 
2645  assert(insheap.size() < insheap.capacity());
2646 
2647  // put item onto heap and siftUp
2648  insheap.push_back(element);
2649  std::push_heap(insheap.begin(), insheap.end(), m_compare);
2650  }
2651  else if (!m_is_very_large_bulk && 1)
2652  {
2653  // if small bulk: if heap is full -> sort locally and put into
2654  // internal array list. insert items but DO NOT keep heap
2655  // invariant.
2656  if (UNLIKELY(insheap.size() >= m_insertion_heap_capacity)) {
2657 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
2658 #pragma omp atomic
2659 #endif
2660  m_heaps_size += m_proc[p]->heap_add_size;
2661 
2662  m_proc[p]->heap_add_size = 0;
2663  flush_insertion_heap(p);
2664  }
2665 
2666  assert(insheap.size() < insheap.capacity());
2667 
2668  // put item onto heap and DO NOT siftUp
2669  insheap.push_back(element);
2670  }
2671  else // m_is_very_large_bulk
2672  {
2673  if (UNLIKELY(insheap.size() >= 2 * 1024 * 1024)) {
2674 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
2675 #pragma omp atomic
2676 #endif
2677  m_heaps_size += m_proc[p]->heap_add_size;
2678 
2679  m_proc[p]->heap_add_size = 0;
2680  flush_insertion_heap(p);
2681  }
2682 
2683  assert(insheap.size() < insheap.capacity());
2684 
2685  // put onto insertion heap but do not keep heap property
2686  insheap.push_back(element);
2687  }
2688 
2689  m_proc[p]->heap_add_size++;
2690  }
2691 
2692  /*!
2693  * Push an element inside a bulk sequence of pushes. Run bulk_push_begin()
2694  * before using this method. This function uses the insertion heap id =
2695  * omp_get_thread_num().
2696  *
2697  * \param element The element to push.
2698  */
2699  void bulk_push(const value_type& element)
2700  {
2701 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
2702  return bulk_push(element, (unsigned_type)omp_get_thread_num());
2703 #else
2704  unsigned_type id = m_rng() % m_num_insertion_heaps;
2705  return bulk_push(element, id);
2706 #endif
2707  }
2708 
2709  /*!
2710  * Ends a sequence of push operations. Run bulk_push_begin() and some
2711  * bulk_push() before this.
2712  */
2713  void bulk_push_end()
2714  {
2715  assert(m_in_bulk_push);
2716  m_in_bulk_push = false;
2717 
2718  if (!m_is_very_large_bulk && 0)
2719  {
2720  for (unsigned p = 0; p < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++p)
2721  {
2722  m_heaps_size += m_proc[p]->heap_add_size;
2723 
2724  if (!m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.empty())
2725  m_minima.update_heap(p);
2726  }
2727  }
2728  else if (!m_is_very_large_bulk && 1)
2729  {
2730 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
2731 #pragma omp parallel for
2732 #endif
2733  for (unsigned p = 0; p < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++p)
2734  {
2735  // reestablish heap property: siftUp only those items pushed
2736  for (unsigned_type index = m_proc[p]->heap_add_size; index != 0; ) {
2737  std::push_heap(m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.begin(),
2738  m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.end() - (--index),
2739  m_compare);
2740  }
2741 
2742 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
2743 #pragma omp atomic
2744 #endif
2745  m_heaps_size += m_proc[p]->heap_add_size;
2746  }
2747 
2748  for (unsigned p = 0; p < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++p)
2749  {
2750  if (!m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.empty())
2751  m_minima.update_heap(p);
2752  }
2753  }
2754  else // m_is_very_large_bulk
2755  {
2756 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
2757 #pragma omp parallel for
2758 #endif
2759  for (unsigned p = 0; p < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++p)
2760  {
2761  if (m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.size() >= m_insertion_heap_capacity) {
2762  // flush out overfull insertion heap arrays
2763 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
2764 #pragma omp atomic
2765 #endif
2766  m_heaps_size += m_proc[p]->heap_add_size;
2767 
2768  m_proc[p]->heap_add_size = 0;
2769  flush_insertion_heap(p);
2770  }
2771  else {
2772  // reestablish heap property: siftUp only those items pushed
2773  for (unsigned_type index = m_proc[p]->heap_add_size; index != 0; ) {
2774  std::push_heap(m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.begin(),
2775  m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.end() - (--index),
2776  m_compare);
2777  }
2778 
2779 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
2780 #pragma omp atomic
2781 #endif
2782  m_heaps_size += m_proc[p]->heap_add_size;
2783  m_proc[p]->heap_add_size = 0;
2784  }
2785  }
2786 
2787  for (unsigned p = 0; p < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++p)
2788  {
2789  if (!m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.empty())
2790  m_minima.update_heap(p);
2791  }
2792  }
2793 
2794  if (m_bulk_first_delayed_external_array != m_external_arrays.size()) {
2795  STXXL_DEBUG("bulk_push_end: run delayed re-hinting of EAs");
2796  rebuild_hint_tree();
2797  }
2798 
2799  check_invariants();
2800  }
2801 
2802  //! Extract up to max_size values at once.
2803  void bulk_pop(std::vector<value_type>& out, size_t max_size)
2804  {
2805  STXXL_DEBUG("bulk_pop_size with max_size=" << max_size);
2806 
2807  const size_t n_elements = std::min<size_t>(max_size, size());
2808  assert(n_elements < m_extract_buffer_limit);
2809 
2810  if (m_heaps_size > 0)
2811  flush_insertion_heaps();
2812 
2813  convert_eb_into_ia();
2814 
2815  refill_extract_buffer(n_elements, n_elements);
2816 
2817  out.resize(0);
2818  using std::swap;
2819  swap(m_extract_buffer, out);
2820  m_extract_buffer_index = 0;
2821  m_extract_buffer_size = 0;
2822  m_minima.deactivate_extract_buffer();
2823 
2824  check_invariants();
2825  }
2826 
2827  //! Extracts all elements which are greater or equal to a given limit.
2828  //! \param out result vector
2829  //! \param limit limit value
2830  //! \param max_size maximum number of items to extract
2831  //! \return true if the buffer contains all items < limit, false it was too
2832  //! small.
2833  bool bulk_pop_limit(std::vector<value_type>& out, const value_type& limit,
2834  size_t max_size = std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max())
2835  {
2836  STXXL_DEBUG("bulk_pop_limit with limit=" << limit);
2837 
2838  convert_eb_into_ia();
2839 
2840  if (m_heaps_size > 0) {
2841  if (0)
2842  flush_insertion_heaps();
2843  else if (1)
2844  flush_insertion_heaps_with_limit(limit);
2845  }
2846 
2847  size_type ias = m_internal_arrays.size();
2848  size_type eas = m_external_arrays.size();
2849  std::vector<size_type> sizes(eas + ias);
2850  std::vector<iterator_pair_type> sequences(eas + ias);
2851  size_type output_size = 0;
2852 
2853  int limiting_ea_index = m_external_min_tree.top();
2854 
2855  // pop limit may have to change due to memory limit
2856  value_type this_limit = limit;
2857  bool has_full_range = true;
2858 
2859  // get all relevant blocks
2860  while (limiting_ea_index > -1)
2861  {
2862  const value_type& ea_limit =
2863  m_external_arrays[limiting_ea_index].get_next_block_min();
2864 
2865  if (m_compare(ea_limit, this_limit)) {
2866  // No more EM data smaller or equal to limit
2867  break;
2868  }
2869 
2870  if (m_external_arrays[limiting_ea_index].num_hinted_blocks() == 0) {
2871  // No more read/prefetch blocks available for EA
2872  this_limit = ea_limit;
2873  has_full_range = false;
2874  break;
2875  }
2876 
2877  wait_next_ea_blocks(limiting_ea_index);
2878  // consider next limiting EA
2879  limiting_ea_index = m_external_min_tree.top();
2880  STXXL_ASSERT(limiting_ea_index < (int)eas);
2881  }
2882 
2883  // build sequences
2884  for (size_type i = 0; i < eas + ias; ++i) {
2885  iterator begin, end;
2886 
2887  if (i < eas) {
2888  assert(!m_external_arrays[i].empty());
2889  assert(m_external_arrays[i].valid());
2890  begin = m_external_arrays[i].begin();
2891  end = m_external_arrays[i].end();
2892  }
2893  else {
2894  size_type j = i - eas;
2895  assert(!(m_internal_arrays[j].empty()));
2896  begin = m_internal_arrays[j].begin();
2897  end = m_internal_arrays[j].end();
2898  }
2899 
2900  end = std::lower_bound(begin, end, this_limit, m_inv_compare);
2901 
2902  sizes[i] = std::distance(begin, end);
2903  sequences[i] = std::make_pair(begin, end);
2904  }
2905 
2906  output_size = std::accumulate(sizes.begin(), sizes.end(), 0);
2907  if (output_size > max_size) {
2908  output_size = max_size;
2909  has_full_range = false;
2910  }
2911  out.resize(output_size);
2912 
2913  STXXL_DEBUG("bulk_pop_limit with" <<
2914  " sequences=" << sequences.size() <<
2915  " output_size=" << output_size <<
2916  " has_full_range=" << has_full_range);
2917 
2918  potentially_parallel::multiway_merge(
2919  sequences.begin(), sequences.end(),
2920  out.begin(), output_size, m_inv_compare);
2921 
2922  advance_arrays(sequences, sizes, eas, ias);
2923 
2924  check_invariants();
2925 
2926  return has_full_range;
2927  }
2928 
2929 #if TODO_MAYBE_FIXUP_LATER
2930  /*!
2931  * Insert a vector of elements at one time.
2932  * \param elements Vector containing the elements to push.
2933  * Attention: elements vector may be owned by the PQ afterwards.
2934  */
2935  void bulk_push_vector(std::vector<value_type>& elements)

3011  /*!
3012  * Insert new element
3013  * \param element the element to insert.
3014  * \param p number of insertion heap to insert item into
3015  */
3016  void push(const value_type& element, unsigned_type p = 0)
3017  {
3018  assert(!m_in_bulk_push && !m_limit_extract);
3019 
3020  heap_type& insheap = m_proc[p]->insertion_heap;
3021 
3022  if (insheap.size() >= m_insertion_heap_capacity) {
3023  flush_insertion_heap(p);
3024  }
3025 
3026  // push item to end of heap and siftUp
3027  insheap.push_back(element);
3028  unsigned_type index = push_heap(insheap.begin(), insheap.end(),
3029  m_compare);
3030  ++m_heaps_size;
3031 
3032  if (insheap.size() == 1 || index == 0)
3033  m_minima.update_heap(p);
3034  }

3036  //! Access the minimum element.
3037  const value_type & top()
3038  {
3039  assert(!m_in_bulk_push && !m_limit_extract);
3040  assert(!empty());
3041 
3042  if (extract_buffer_empty()) {
3043  refill_extract_buffer(std::min(m_extract_buffer_limit,
3044  m_internal_size + m_external_size));
3045  }
3046 
3047  static const bool debug = false;
3048 
3049  std::pair<unsigned, unsigned> type_and_index = m_minima.top();
3050  const unsigned& type = type_and_index.first;
3051  const unsigned& index = type_and_index.second;
3052 
3053  assert(type < 4);
3054 
3055  switch (type) {
3056  case minima_type::HEAP:
3057  STXXL_DEBUG("heap " << index <<
3058  ": " << m_proc[index]->insertion_heap[0]);
3059  return m_proc[index]->insertion_heap[0];
3060  case minima_type::IA:
3061  STXXL_DEBUG("ia " << index <<
3062  ": " << m_internal_arrays[index].get_min());
3063  return m_internal_arrays[index].get_min();
3064  case minima_type::EB:
3065  STXXL_DEBUG("eb " << m_extract_buffer_index <<
3066  ": " << m_extract_buffer[m_extract_buffer_index]);
3067  return m_extract_buffer[m_extract_buffer_index];
3068  default:
3069  STXXL_ERRMSG("Unknown extract type: " << type);
3070  abort();
3071  }
3072  }

3074  //! Remove the minimum element.
3075  void pop()
3076  {
3077  assert(!m_in_bulk_push && !m_limit_extract);
3078 
3079  m_stats.num_extracts++;
3080 
3081  if (extract_buffer_empty()) {
3082  refill_extract_buffer(std::min(m_extract_buffer_limit,
3083  m_internal_size + m_external_size));
3084  }
3085 
3086  m_stats.extract_min_time.start();
3087 
3088  std::pair<unsigned, unsigned> type_and_index = m_minima.top();
3089  unsigned type = type_and_index.first;
3090  unsigned index = type_and_index.second;
3091 
3092  assert(type < 4);
3093 
3094  switch (type) {
3095  case minima_type::HEAP:
3096  {
3097  heap_type& insheap = m_proc[index]->insertion_heap;
3098 
3099  m_stats.pop_heap_time.start();
3100  std::pop_heap(insheap.begin(), insheap.end(), m_compare);
3101  insheap.pop_back();
3102  m_stats.pop_heap_time.stop();
3103 
3104  m_heaps_size--;
3105 
3106  if (!insheap.empty())
3107  m_minima.update_heap(index);
3108  else
3109  m_minima.deactivate_heap(index);
3110 
3111  break;
3112  }
3113  case minima_type::IA:
3114  {
3115  m_internal_arrays[index].inc_min();
3116  m_internal_size--;
3117 
3118  if (!(m_internal_arrays[index].empty()))
3119  m_minima.update_internal_array(index);
3120  else
3121  // internal array has run empty
3122  m_minima.deactivate_internal_array(index);
3123 
3124  break;
3125  }
3126  case minima_type::EB:
3127  {
3128  ++m_extract_buffer_index;
3129  assert(m_extract_buffer_size > 0);
3130  --m_extract_buffer_size;
3131 
3132  if (!extract_buffer_empty())
3133  m_minima.update_extract_buffer();
3134  else
3135  m_minima.deactivate_extract_buffer();
3136 
3137  break;
3138  }
3139  default:
3140  STXXL_ERRMSG("Unknown extract type: " << type);
3141  abort();
3142  }
3143 
3144  m_stats.extract_min_time.stop();
3145 
3146  check_invariants();
3147  }

3151  //! \name Bulk-Limit Operations
3152  //! \{
3153 
3154 protected:

3156  value_type m_limit_element;

3164 public:
3165  //! Begin bulk-limit extraction session with limit element.
3166  void limit_begin(const value_type& limit, size_type bulk_size)
3167  {

3169  m_limit_element = limit;
3170 
3171  std::vector<value_type> new_extract_buffer;
3172  m_limit_has_full_range =
3173  bulk_pop_limit(new_extract_buffer, limit, m_extract_buffer_limit);
3174  std::swap(new_extract_buffer, m_extract_buffer);
3175 
3176  m_extract_buffer_index = 0;
3177  m_extract_buffer_size = m_extract_buffer.size();
3178  if (m_extract_buffer_size)
3179  m_minima.update_extract_buffer();
3180  else
3181  m_minima.deactivate_extract_buffer();

3184  }

3188  {

3190  assert(!m_compare(m_limit_element, element));
3191 
3192  return bulk_push(element, p);
3193  }
3194 
3195  //! Access the minimum element, which can only be in the extract buffer.
3196  const value_type & limit_top()
3197  {
3198  assert(m_limit_extract);
3199 
3200  // if buffer is empty and we extracted the full range last time, return
3201  // limit items as sentinel.
3202  if (m_extract_buffer_size == 0 && m_limit_has_full_range)
3203  return m_limit_element;
3204 
3205  if (extract_buffer_empty())
3206  {
3207  // extract more items
3208  std::vector<value_type> new_extract_buffer;
3209  m_limit_has_full_range =
3210  bulk_pop_limit(new_extract_buffer, m_limit_element,
3211  m_extract_buffer_limit);
3212 
3213  std::swap(new_extract_buffer, m_extract_buffer);
3214 
3215  m_extract_buffer_index = 0;
3216  m_extract_buffer_size = m_extract_buffer.size();
3217  if (m_extract_buffer_size)
3218  m_minima.update_extract_buffer();
3219  else
3220  m_minima.deactivate_extract_buffer();
3221  }
3222 
3223  return m_extract_buffer[m_extract_buffer_index];
3224  }

3226  //! Remove the minimum element, only works correctly while elements < L.
3227  void limit_pop()

3230 
3231  ++m_extract_buffer_index;
3232  assert(m_extract_buffer_size > 0);
3233  --m_extract_buffer_size;
3234 
3235  if (extract_buffer_empty() && !m_limit_has_full_range)
3236  {
3237  // extract more items
3238  std::vector<value_type> new_extract_buffer;
3239  m_limit_has_full_range =
3240  bulk_pop_limit(new_extract_buffer, m_limit_element,
3241  m_extract_buffer_limit);
3242 
3243  std::swap(new_extract_buffer, m_extract_buffer);
3244 
3245  m_extract_buffer_index = 0;
3246  m_extract_buffer_size = m_extract_buffer.size();
3247  if (m_extract_buffer_size)
3248  m_minima.update_extract_buffer();
3249  else
3250  m_minima.deactivate_extract_buffer();
3251  }
3252  }
3253 
3254  //! Finish bulk-limit extraction session.

3258

3264  //! \}
3265 
3266 protected:
3267  //! Flushes all elements of the insertion heaps which are greater
3268  //! or equal to a given limit.
3269  //! \param limit limit value
3270  void flush_insertion_heaps_with_limit(const value_type& limit)
3271  {
3272  // perform extract for all items < L into back of insertion_heap
3273  std::vector<unsigned_type> back_size(m_num_insertion_heaps);
3274 
3275 //#if STXXL_PARALLEL
3276 //#pragma omp parallel for
3277 //#endif
3278  for (size_t p = 0; p < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++p)
3279  {
3280  heap_type& insheap = m_proc[p]->insertion_heap;
3281 
3282  typename heap_type::iterator back = insheap.end();
3283 
3284  while (back != insheap.begin() &&
3285  m_compare(limit, insheap[0]))
3286  {
3287  // while top < L, perform pop_heap: put top to back and
3288  // siftDown new items (shortens heap by one)
3289  std::pop_heap(insheap.begin(), back, m_compare);
3290  --back;
3291  }
3292 
3293  // range insheap.begin() + back to insheap.end() is < L, rest >= L.
3294 
3295  for (typename heap_type::const_iterator it = insheap.begin();
3296  it != insheap.end(); ++it)
3297  {
3298  if (it < back)
3299  assert(!m_compare(limit, *it));
3300  else
3301  assert(m_compare(limit, *it));
3302  }
3303 
3304  back_size[p] = insheap.end() - back;
3305  }
3306 
3307  // put items from insertion heaps into an internal array
3308  unsigned_type back_sum = std::accumulate(
3309  back_size.begin(), back_size.end(), unsigned_type(0));
3310 
3311  STXXL_DEBUG("flush_insertion_heaps_with_limit(): back_sum = " << back_sum);
3312 
3313  if (back_sum)
3314  {
3315  // test that enough RAM is available for remaining items
3316  flush_ia_ea_until_memory_free(back_sum * sizeof(value_type));
3317 
3318  std::vector<value_type> values(back_sum);
3319 
3320  // copy items into values vector
3321  typename std::vector<value_type>::iterator vi = values.begin();
3322  for (size_t p = 0; p < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++p)
3323  {
3324  heap_type& insheap = m_proc[p]->insertion_heap;
3325 
3326  std::copy(insheap.end() - back_size[p], insheap.end(), vi);
3327  vi += back_size[p];
3328  insheap.resize(insheap.size() - back_size[p]);
3329 
3330  if (insheap.empty())
3331  m_minima.deactivate_heap(p);
3332  else
3333  m_minima.update_heap(p);
3334  }
3335 
3336  potentially_parallel::sort(values.begin(), values.end(), m_inv_compare);
3337 
3338  add_as_internal_array(values);
3339  m_heaps_size -= back_sum;
3340  }
3341  }
3342 
3343 public:
3344  /*!
3345  * Merges all external arrays and all internal arrays into one external array.
3346  * Public for benchmark purposes.
3347  */
3348  void merge_external_arrays()
3349  {
3350  STXXL_ERRMSG("Merging external arrays. This should not happen."
3351  << " You should adjust memory assignment and/or external array level size.");
3352  check_external_level(0, true);
3353  STXXL_DEBUG("Merging all external arrays done.");
3354 
3355  resize_read_pool();
3356 
3357  // Rebuild hint tree completely as the hint sequence may have changed.
3358  if (!m_in_bulk_push)
3359  rebuild_hint_tree();
3360  else
3361  assert(m_external_arrays.size() - 1 >= m_bulk_first_delayed_external_array);
3362 
3363  check_invariants();
3364  }
3365 
3366  //! Free up memory by flushing internal arrays and combining external
3367  //! arrays until enough bytes are free.
3368  void flush_ia_ea_until_memory_free(internal_size_type mem_free)
3369  {
3370  if (m_mem_left >= mem_free) return;
3371 
3372  if (m_internal_size > 0) {
3373  flush_internal_arrays();
3374  }
3375  else {
3376  merge_external_arrays();
3377  }
3378 
3379  assert(m_mem_left >= mem_free);
3380  }
3381 
3382  //! Automatically resize the read/prefetch buffer pool depending on number
3383  //! of external arrays.
3384  void resize_read_pool()
3385  {
3386  unsigned_type new_num_read_blocks =
3387  m_num_read_blocks_per_ea * m_external_arrays.size();
3388 
3389  STXXL_DEBUG("resize_read_pool:" <<
3390  " m_num_read_blocks=" << m_num_read_blocks <<
3391  " ea_size=" << m_external_arrays.size() <<
3392  " m_num_read_blocks_per_ea=" << m_num_read_blocks_per_ea <<
3393  " new_num_read_blocks=" << new_num_read_blocks <<
3394  " free_size_prefetch=" << m_pool.free_size_prefetch() <<
3395  " m_num_hinted_blocks=" << m_num_hinted_blocks <<
3396  " m_num_used_read_blocks=" << m_num_used_read_blocks);
3397 
3398  // add new blocks
3399  if (new_num_read_blocks > m_num_read_blocks)
3400  {
3401  unsigned_type mem_needed =
3402  (new_num_read_blocks - m_num_read_blocks) * block_size;
3403 
3404  // -tb: this may recursively call this function!
3405  //flush_ia_ea_until_memory_free(mem_needed);
3406  STXXL_ASSERT(m_mem_left >= mem_needed);
3407 
3408  while (new_num_read_blocks > m_num_read_blocks) {
3409  block_type* new_block = new block_type();
3410  m_pool.add_prefetch(new_block);
3411  ++m_num_read_blocks;
3412  }
3413 
3414  m_mem_left -= mem_needed;
3415  }
3416 
3417  // steal extra blocks (as many as possible)
3418  if (new_num_read_blocks < m_num_read_blocks)
3419  {
3420  while (new_num_read_blocks < m_num_read_blocks &&
3421  m_pool.free_size_prefetch() > 0)
3422  {
3423  block_type* del_block = m_pool.steal_prefetch();
3424  delete del_block;
3425  --m_num_read_blocks;
3426  m_mem_left += block_size;
3427  }
3428 
3429  if (new_num_read_blocks < m_num_read_blocks)
3430  STXXL_ERRMSG("WARNING: could not immediately reduce read/prefetch pool!");
3431  }
3432  }
3433 
3434  //! Rebuild hint tree completely as the hint sequence may have changed, and
3435  //! re-hint the correct block sequence.
3436  void rebuild_hint_tree()
3437  {
3438  m_stats.hint_time.start();
3439 
3440  // prepare rehinting sequence: reset hint begin pointer
3441  for (size_t i = 0; i < m_external_arrays.size(); ++i)
3442  m_external_arrays[i].rebuild_hints_prepare();
3443 
3444  // rebuild hint tree with first elements
3445  for (size_t i = 0; i < m_external_arrays.size(); ++i)
3446  {
3447  if (m_external_arrays[i].has_unhinted_em_data()) {
3448  m_hint_tree.activate_without_replay(i);
3449  }
3450  else {
3451  m_hint_tree.deactivate_without_replay(i);
3452  }
3453  }
3454  m_hint_tree.rebuild();
3455 
3456  // virtually release all hints
3457  unsigned_type free_prefetch_blocks =
3458  m_pool.free_size_prefetch() + m_num_hinted_blocks;
3459  m_num_hinted_blocks = 0;
3460 
3461  int gmin_index;
3462  while (free_prefetch_blocks > 0 &&
3463  (gmin_index = m_hint_tree.top()) >= 0)
3464  {
3465  assert((size_t)gmin_index < m_external_arrays.size());
3466 
3467  STXXL_DEBUG("Give pre-hint in EA[" << gmin_index << "] min " <<
3468  m_external_arrays[gmin_index].get_next_hintable_min());
3469 
3470  m_external_arrays[gmin_index].rebuild_hints_prehint_next_block();
3471  --free_prefetch_blocks;
3472  ++m_num_hinted_blocks;
3473 
3474  if (m_external_arrays[gmin_index].has_unhinted_em_data()) {
3475  m_hint_tree.replay_on_change(gmin_index);
3476  }
3477  else {
3478  m_hint_tree.deactivate_player(gmin_index);
3479  }
3480  }
3481 
3482  // invalidate all hinted blocks no longer needed
3483  for (size_t i = 0; i < m_external_arrays.size(); ++i)
3484  m_external_arrays[i].rebuild_hints_cancel();
3485 
3486  // perform real hinting on pre-hinted blocks
3487  for (size_t i = 0; i < m_external_arrays.size(); ++i)
3488  m_external_arrays[i].rebuild_hints_finish();
3489 
3490  assert(free_prefetch_blocks == m_pool.free_size_prefetch());
3491 
3492  m_stats.hint_time.stop();
3493  }
3494 
3495  //! Updates the prefetch prediction tree afer a remove_items(), which frees
3496  //! up blocks.
3497  //! \param ea_index index of the external array in question
3498  inline void update_hint_tree(size_t ea_index)
3499  {
3500  m_stats.hint_time.start();
3501  if (m_external_arrays[ea_index].has_unhinted_em_data()) {
3502  m_hint_tree.replay_on_change(ea_index);
3503  }
3504  else {
3505  m_hint_tree.deactivate_player(ea_index);
3506  }
3507  m_stats.hint_time.stop();
3508  }
3509 
3510  //! Updates the external min tree afer a remove() or a
3511  //! wait_next_blocks() call.
3512  //! \param ea_index index of the external array in question
3513  inline void update_external_min_tree(size_t ea_index)
3514  {
3515  if (m_external_arrays[ea_index].has_em_data()) {
3516  m_external_min_tree.replay_on_change(ea_index);
3517  }
3518  else {
3519  m_external_min_tree.deactivate_player(ea_index);
3520  }
3521  }
3522 
3523  //! Hints EA blocks which will be needed soon. Hints at most
3524  //! m_num_prefetchers blocks globally.
3525  inline void hint_external_arrays()
3526  {
3527  m_stats.hint_time.start();
3528 
3529  STXXL_DEBUG("hint_external_arrays()"
3530  " for free_size_prefetch=" << m_pool.free_size_prefetch());
3531 
3532  int gmin_index;
3533  while (m_pool.free_size_prefetch() > 0 &&
3534  (gmin_index = m_hint_tree.top()) >= 0)
3535  {
3536  assert((size_t)gmin_index < m_external_arrays.size());
3537 
3538  STXXL_DEBUG("Give hint in EA[" << gmin_index << "]");
3539  m_external_arrays[gmin_index].hint_next_block();
3540  ++m_num_hinted_blocks;
3541 
3542  if (m_external_arrays[gmin_index].has_unhinted_em_data()) {
3543  m_hint_tree.replay_on_change(gmin_index);
3544  }
3545  else {
3546  m_hint_tree.deactivate_player(gmin_index);
3547  }
3548  }
3549 
3550  m_stats.hint_time.stop();
3551  }

3580 
3581 protected:
3582  //! Calculates the sequences vector needed by the multiway merger,
3583  //! considering inaccessible data from external arrays.
3584  //! The sizes vector stores the size of each sequence.
3585  //! \param reuse_previous_lower_bounds Reuse upper bounds from previous runs.
3586  //! sequences[i].second must be valid upper bound iterator from a previous run!
3587  //! \returns the index of the external array which is limiting factor
3588  //! or m_external_arrays.size() if not limited.
3589  size_t calculate_merge_sequences(std::vector<size_type>& sizes,
3590  std::vector<iterator_pair_type>& sequences,
3591  bool reuse_previous_lower_bounds = false)
3592  {
3593  STXXL_DEBUG("calculate merge sequences");
3594 
3595  static const bool debug = false;
3596 
3597  const size_type eas = m_external_arrays.size();
3598  const size_type ias = m_internal_arrays.size();
3599 
3600  assert(sizes.size() == eas + ias);
3601  assert(sequences.size() == eas + ias);
3602 
3603  /*
3604  * determine minimum of each first block
3605  */
3606 
3607  int gmin_index = m_external_min_tree.top();
3608  bool needs_limit = (gmin_index >= 0) ? true : false;
3609 
3610 // test correctness of external block min tree
3611 #ifdef STXXL_DEBUG_ASSERTIONS
3612 
3613  bool test_needs_limit = false;
3614  int test_gmin_index = 0;
3615  value_type test_gmin_value;
3616 
3617  m_stats.refill_minmax_time.start();
3618  for (size_type i = 0; i < eas; ++i) {
3619  if (m_external_arrays[i].has_em_data()) {
3620  const value_type& min_value =
3621  m_external_arrays[i].get_next_block_min();
3622 
3623  if (!test_needs_limit) {
3624  test_needs_limit = true;
3625  test_gmin_value = min_value;
3626  test_gmin_index = i;
3627  }
3628  else {
3629  STXXL_DEBUG("min[" << i << "]: " << min_value <<
3630  " test: " << test_gmin_value <<
3631  ": " << m_inv_compare(min_value, test_gmin_value));
3632  if (m_inv_compare(min_value, test_gmin_value)) {
3633  test_gmin_value = min_value;
3634  test_gmin_index = i;
3635  }
3636  }
3637  }
3638  }
3639  m_stats.refill_minmax_time.stop();
3640 
3641  STXXL_ASSERT(needs_limit == test_needs_limit);
3642  STXXL_ASSERT(!needs_limit || gmin_index == test_gmin_index);
3643 
3644 #endif
3645 
3646  /*
3647  * calculate size and create sequences to merge
3648  */
3649 
3650 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
3651 // #pragma omp parallel for if(eas + ias > m_num_insertion_heaps)
3652 #endif
3653  for (size_type i = 0; i < eas + ias; ++i) {
3654  iterator begin, end;
3655 
3656  if (i < eas) {
3657  begin = m_external_arrays[i].begin();
3658  end = m_external_arrays[i].end();
3659  }
3660  else {
3661  size_type j = i - eas;
3662  begin = m_internal_arrays[j].begin();
3663  end = m_internal_arrays[j].end();
3664  }
3665 
3666  if (needs_limit) {
3667  const value_type& gmin_value =
3668  m_external_arrays[gmin_index].get_next_block_min();
3669 
3670  // remove timer if parallel
3671  //stats.refill_lower_bound_time.start();
3672  if (reuse_previous_lower_bounds) {
3673  // Be careful that sequences[i].second is really valid and
3674  // set by a previous calculate_merge_sequences() run!
3675  end = std::lower_bound(sequences[i].second, end,
3676  gmin_value, m_inv_compare);
3677  }
3678  else
3679  {
3680  end = std::lower_bound(begin, end,
3681  gmin_value, m_inv_compare);
3682  }
3683  //stats.refill_lower_bound_time.stop();
3684  }
3685 
3686  sizes[i] = std::distance(begin, end);
3687  sequences[i] = std::make_pair(begin, end);
3688 
3689  STXXL_DEBUG("sequence[" << i << "] " << (i < eas ? "ea " : "ia ") <<
3690  begin << " - " << end <<
3691  " size " << sizes[i] <<
3692  (needs_limit ? " with ub limit" : ""));
3693  }
3694 
3695  if (needs_limit) {
3696  STXXL_DEBUG("return with needs_limit: gmin_index=" << gmin_index);
3697  return gmin_index;
3698  }
3699  else {
3700  STXXL_DEBUG("return with needs_limit: eas=" << eas);
3701  return eas;
3702  }
3703  }
3704 
3705 protected:
3706  //! Convert extract buffer into a new internal array.
3707  void convert_eb_into_ia(bool do_not_flush = false)
3708  {
3709  if (m_extract_buffer_size == 0) return;
3710 
3711  STXXL_DEBUG("convert_eb_into_ia");
3712 
3713  // tb: if in limit sequence and the EB gets flushed out to EM, then we
3714  // have to re-merge items into the EB instead of returning the
3715  // sentinel.
3716  m_limit_has_full_range = false;
3717 
3718  // TODO: memory is NOT allocated, but extract buffer is currently not
3719  // counted
3720  if (!do_not_flush)
3721  flush_ia_ea_until_memory_free(
3722  internal_array_type::int_memory(m_extract_buffer.size())
3723  );
3724 
3725  if (m_extract_buffer_size == 0) return;
3726 
3727  // first deactivate extract buffer to replay tree for new IA.
3728  m_minima.deactivate_extract_buffer();
3729 
3730  // add eb as internal array with current index
3731  add_as_internal_array(m_extract_buffer, m_extract_buffer_index);
3732 
3733  m_extract_buffer_index = 0;
3734  m_extract_buffer_size = 0;
3735  }
3736 
3737  //! Refills the extract buffer from the external arrays.
3738  //! \param minimum_size requested minimum size of the resulting extract buffer.
3739  //! Prints a warning if there is not enough data to reach this size.
3740  //! \param maximum_size maximum size of the extract buffer. Using
3741  //! m_extract_buffer_limit if set to 0.
3742  inline void refill_extract_buffer(size_t minimum_size = 0,
3743  size_t maximum_size = 0)
3744  {
3745  STXXL_DEBUG("refilling extract buffer" <<
3746  " ia_size=" << m_internal_arrays.size() <<
3747  " ea_size=" << m_external_arrays.size());
3748 
3749  if (maximum_size == 0)
3750  maximum_size = m_extract_buffer_limit;
3751 
3752  check_invariants();
3753 
3754  assert(extract_buffer_empty());
3755  m_extract_buffer_index = 0;
3756 
3757  cleanup_external_arrays();
3758 
3759  size_type ias, eas = m_external_arrays.size();
3760 
3761  m_minima.clear_internal_arrays();
3762  cleanup_internal_arrays();
3763  ias = m_internal_arrays.size();
3764 
3765  if (eas == 0 && ias == 0) {
3766  m_extract_buffer.resize(0);
3767  m_minima.deactivate_extract_buffer();
3768  return;
3769  }
3770 
3771  m_stats.num_extract_buffer_refills++;
3772  m_stats.refill_extract_buffer_time.start();
3773  m_stats.refill_time_before_merge.start();
3774 
3775  std::vector<size_type> sizes(eas + ias);
3776  std::vector<iterator_pair_type> sequences(eas + ias);
3777  size_type output_size = 0;
3778 
3779  if (minimum_size > 0) {
3780  size_t limiting_ea_index = eas + 1;
3781  bool reuse_lower_bounds = false;
3782  while (output_size < minimum_size)
3783  {
3784  STXXL_DEBUG("refill: request more data," <<
3785  " output_size=" << output_size <<
3786  " minimum_size=" << minimum_size <<
3787  " limiting_ea_index=" << limiting_ea_index);
3788 
3789  if (limiting_ea_index < eas) {
3790  if (m_external_arrays[limiting_ea_index].num_hinted_blocks() == 0)
3791  break;
3792 
3793  wait_next_ea_blocks(limiting_ea_index);
3794  reuse_lower_bounds = true;
3795  }
3796  else if (limiting_ea_index == eas) {
3797  // no more unaccessible EM data
3798  STXXL_MSG("Warning: refill_extract_buffer(n): "
3799  "minimum_size > # mergeable elements!");
3800  break;
3801  }
3802 
3803  limiting_ea_index = calculate_merge_sequences(
3804  sizes, sequences, reuse_lower_bounds);
3805 
3806  output_size = std::accumulate(sizes.begin(), sizes.end(), 0);
3807  }
3808  }
3809  else {
3810  calculate_merge_sequences(sizes, sequences);
3811  output_size = std::accumulate(sizes.begin(), sizes.end(), 0);
3812  }
3813 
3814  if (c_limit_extract_buffer) {
3815  output_size = std::min<size_t>(output_size, maximum_size);
3816  }
3817 
3818  m_stats.max_extract_buffer_size.set_max(output_size);
3819  m_stats.total_extract_buffer_size += output_size;
3820 
3821  assert(output_size > 0);
3822  m_extract_buffer.resize(output_size);
3823  m_extract_buffer_size = output_size;
3824 
3825  m_stats.refill_time_before_merge.stop();
3826  m_stats.refill_merge_time.start();
3827 
3828  potentially_parallel::multiway_merge(
3829  sequences.begin(), sequences.end(),
3830  m_extract_buffer.begin(), output_size, m_inv_compare);
3831 
3832  m_stats.refill_merge_time.stop();
3833  m_stats.refill_time_after_merge.start();
3834 
3835  advance_arrays(sequences, sizes, eas, ias);
3836 
3837  m_minima.update_extract_buffer();
3838 
3839  m_stats.refill_time_after_merge.stop();
3840  m_stats.refill_extract_buffer_time.stop();
3841 
3842  check_invariants();
3843  }
3844 
3845  //! Requests more EM data from a given EA and updates
3846  //! the winner trees and hints accordingly.
3847  inline void wait_next_ea_blocks(unsigned_type ea_index)
3848  {
3849  unsigned_type used_blocks =
3850  m_external_arrays[ea_index].wait_next_blocks();
3851 
3852  m_num_hinted_blocks -= used_blocks;
3853  m_num_used_read_blocks += used_blocks;
3854 
3855  update_external_min_tree(ea_index);
3856  }
3857 
3858  // Removes empty arrays and updates the winner trees accordingly
3859  inline void advance_arrays(std::vector<iterator_pair_type>& sequences,
3860  std::vector<size_type>& sizes,
3861  size_t eas, size_t ias)
3862  {
3863  unsigned_type total_freed_blocks = 0;
3864 
3865  for (size_type i = 0; i < eas + ias; ++i) {
3866  // dist represents the number of elements that haven't been merged
3867  size_type dist = std::distance(sequences[i].first,
3868  sequences[i].second);
3869  const size_t diff = sizes[i] - dist;
3870  if (diff == 0) continue;
3871 
3872  if (i < eas) {
3873  // remove items and free blocks in RAM.
3874  unsigned_type freed_blocks =
3875  m_external_arrays[i].remove_items(diff);
3876 
3877  m_num_used_read_blocks -= freed_blocks;
3878  total_freed_blocks += freed_blocks;
3879 
3880  // correct item count.
3881  assert(m_external_size >= diff);
3882  m_external_size -= diff;
3883  }
3884  else {
3885  size_type j = i - eas;
3886  m_internal_arrays[j].inc_min(diff);
3887  assert(m_internal_size >= diff);
3888  m_internal_size -= diff;
3889  }
3890  }
3891 
3892  // remove empty arrays - important for the next round (may also reduce
3893  // number of prefetch buffers, so must be before hinting).
3894  cleanup_external_arrays();
3895 
3896  // prefetch new blocks from EAs using freed blocks
3897  if (total_freed_blocks)
3898  hint_external_arrays();
3899 
3900  m_stats.num_new_external_arrays = 0;
3901  cleanup_internal_arrays();
3902  }
3903 
3904  //! Flushes the insertions heap p into an internal array.
3905  inline void flush_insertion_heap(unsigned_type p)
3906  {
3907  assert(m_proc[p]->insertion_heap.size() != 0);
3908 
3909  heap_type& insheap = m_proc[p]->insertion_heap;
3910  size_t size = insheap.size();
3911 
3912  STXXL_DEBUG0(
3913  "Flushing insertion heap array p=" << p <<
3914  " size=" << insheap.size() <<
3915  " capacity=" << insheap.capacity() <<
3916  " int_memory=" << internal_array_type::int_memory(insheap.size()) <<
3917  " mem_left=" << m_mem_left);
3918 
3919  m_stats.num_insertion_heap_flushes++;
3920  stats_timer flush_time(true); // separate timer due to parallel sorting
3921 
3922  // sort locally, independent of others
3923  std::sort(insheap.begin(), insheap.end(), m_inv_compare);
3924 
3925 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
3926 #pragma omp critical (stxxl_flush_insertion_heap)
3927 #endif
3928  {
3929  // test that enough RAM is available for merged internal array:
3930  // otherwise flush the existing internal arrays out to disk.
3931  flush_ia_ea_until_memory_free(
3932  internal_array_type::int_memory(insheap.size()));
3933 
3934  // invalidate player in minima tree (before adding the IA to tree)
3935  m_minima.deactivate_heap(p);
3936 
3937  // insheap is empty afterwards, as vector was swapped into new_array
3938  add_as_internal_array(insheap);
3939 
3940  // reserve new insertion heap
3941  insheap.reserve(m_insertion_heap_capacity);
3942  assert(insheap.capacity() * sizeof(value_type)
3943  == insertion_heap_int_memory());
3944 
3945  // update item counts
3946 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
3947 #pragma omp atomic
3948 #endif
3949  m_heaps_size -= size;
3950  }
3951 
3952  m_stats.insertion_heap_flush_time += flush_time;
3953  }
3954 
3955  //! Flushes all insertions heaps into an internal array.
3956  inline void flush_insertion_heaps()
3957  {
3958  size_type max_mem_needed;
3959 
3960  if (c_merge_sorted_heaps) {
3961  max_mem_needed = m_mem_for_heaps;
3962  }
3963  else {
3964  max_mem_needed = insertion_heap_int_memory();
3965  }
3966 
3967  // test that enough RAM is available for merged internal array:
3968  // otherwise flush the existing internal arrays out to disk.
3969  flush_ia_ea_until_memory_free(max_mem_needed);
3970 
3971  m_stats.num_insertion_heap_flushes++;
3972  m_stats.insertion_heap_flush_time.start();
3973 
3974  size_type size = m_heaps_size;
3975  size_type int_memory = 0;
3976  assert(size > 0);
3977  std::vector<std::pair<value_iterator, value_iterator> > sequences(m_num_insertion_heaps);
3978 
3979 #if STXXL_PARALLEL
3980  #pragma omp parallel for
3981 #endif
3982  for (unsigned i = 0; i < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++i)
3983  {
3984  heap_type& insheap = m_proc[i]->insertion_heap;
3985 
3986  std::sort(insheap.begin(), insheap.end(), m_inv_compare);
3987 
3988  if (c_merge_sorted_heaps)
3989  sequences[i] = std::make_pair(insheap.begin(), insheap.end());
3990 
3991  int_memory += insheap.capacity();
3992  }
3993 
3994  if (c_merge_sorted_heaps)
3995  {
3996  m_stats.merge_sorted_heaps_time.start();
3997  std::vector<value_type> merged_array(size);
3998 
3999  potentially_parallel::multiway_merge(
4000  sequences.begin(), sequences.end(),
4001  merged_array.begin(), size, m_inv_compare);
4002 
4003  m_stats.merge_sorted_heaps_time.stop();
4004 
4005  add_as_internal_array(merged_array);
4006 
4007  for (unsigned i = 0; i < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++i)
4008  {
4009  m_proc[i]->insertion_heap.clear();
4010  m_proc[i]->insertion_heap.reserve(m_insertion_heap_capacity);
4011  }
4012  m_minima.clear_heaps();
4013  }
4014  else
4015  {
4016  for (unsigned i = 0; i < m_num_insertion_heaps; ++i)
4017  {
4018  heap_type& insheap = m_proc[i]->insertion_heap;
4019 
4020  if (insheap.size() == 0) continue;
4021 
4022  add_as_internal_array(insheap);
4023 
4024  // reserve new insertion heap
4025  insheap.reserve(m_insertion_heap_capacity);
4026  }
4027 
4028  m_minima.clear_heaps();
4029  }
4030 
4031  m_heaps_size = 0;
4032 
4033  m_stats.insertion_heap_flush_time.stop();
4034 
4035  check_invariants();
4036  }

4038  //! Flushes the internal arrays into an external array.
4039  void flush_internal_arrays()
4040  {
4041  STXXL_DEBUG("Flushing internal arrays" <<
4042  " num_arrays=" << m_internal_arrays.size());
4043 
4044  m_stats.num_internal_array_flushes++;
4045  m_stats.internal_array_flush_time.start();
4046 
4047  m_minima.clear_internal_arrays();
4048 
4049  // also flush extract buffer items out to disk.
4050  convert_eb_into_ia(true);
4051 
4052  // clean up internal arrays that have been deleted in extract_min!
4053  cleanup_internal_arrays();
4054 
4055  size_type num_arrays = m_internal_arrays.size();
4056  size_type size = m_internal_size;
4057  size_type int_memory = 0;
4058  std::vector<iterator_pair_type> sequences(num_arrays);
4059 
4060  for (unsigned i = 0; i < num_arrays; ++i)
4061  {
4062  sequences[i] = std::make_pair(m_internal_arrays[i].begin(),
4063  m_internal_arrays[i].end());
4064 
4065  int_memory += m_internal_arrays[i].int_memory();
4066  }
4067 
4068  // must release more RAM in IAs than the EA takes, otherwise: merge
4069  // external and internal arrays!
4070  if (int_memory < external_array_type::int_memory(size)
4071  + ceil(m_num_read_blocks_per_ea) * block_size)
4072  {
4073  return merge_external_arrays();
4074  }
4075 
4076  // construct new external array
4077 
4078  external_array_type ea(size, &m_pool, 0);
4079 
4080  m_stats.max_merge_buffer_size.set_max(size);
4081 
4082  {
4083  external_array_writer_type external_array_writer(ea);
4084 
4085  potentially_parallel::multiway_merge(
4086  sequences.begin(), sequences.end(),
4087  external_array_writer.begin(), size, m_inv_compare);
4088  }
4089 
4090  STXXL_DEBUG("Merge done of new ea " << &ea);
4091 
4092  m_external_arrays.swap_back(ea);
4093 
4094  m_internal_size = 0;
4095  m_external_size += size;
4096 
4097  // register EA in min tree
4098  // important for check_external_level()!
4099  m_external_min_tree.activate_without_replay(m_external_arrays.size() - 1);
4100  update_external_min_tree(m_external_arrays.size() - 1);
4101 
4102  // register EA in hint tree
4103  m_hint_tree.activate_without_replay(m_external_arrays.size() - 1);
4104  if (!m_in_bulk_push)
4105  update_hint_tree(m_external_arrays.size() - 1);
4106  // else: done in bulk_push_end() -> rebuild_hint_tree()
4107 
4108  m_internal_arrays.clear();
4109  m_stats.num_new_internal_arrays = 0;
4110  cleanup_internal_arrays();
4111 
4112  // TODO: is this necessary? See cleanup_internal_arrays().
4113  for (size_t i = 0; i < c_max_internal_levels; ++i)
4114  m_internal_levels[i] = 0;
4115 
4116  m_mem_left += int_memory;
4117  m_mem_left -= m_external_arrays.back().int_memory();
4118 
4119  m_stats.max_num_external_arrays.set_max(m_external_arrays.size());
4120  m_stats.internal_array_flush_time.stop();
4121 
4122  // update EA level and potentially merge
4123  ++m_external_levels[0];
4124  check_external_level(0);
4125 
4126  resize_read_pool();
4127  // Rebuild hint tree completely as the hint sequence may have changed.
4128  if (!m_in_bulk_push)
4129  rebuild_hint_tree();
4130  else
4131  assert(m_external_arrays.size() - 1 >= m_bulk_first_delayed_external_array);
4132 
4133  check_invariants();
4134  }

4136  // Compares the largest accessible value of two external arrays.
4137  struct s_min_tree_comparator {
4138  const external_arrays_type& m_eas;
4139  const std::vector<unsigned_type>& m_indices;
4140  const inv_compare_type& m_compare;
4141 
4142  s_min_tree_comparator(const external_arrays_type& eas,
4143  const inv_compare_type& compare,
4144  const std::vector<unsigned_type>& indices)
4145  : m_eas(eas), m_indices(indices), m_compare(compare) { }
4146 
4147  bool operator () (const size_t& a, const size_t& b) const
4148  {
4149  return m_compare(m_eas[m_indices[a]].get_next_hintable_min(),
4150  m_eas[m_indices[b]].get_next_hintable_min());
4151  }
4152  };
4153 
4154  //! Merges external arrays if there are too many external arrays on
4155  //! the same level.
4156  void check_external_level(unsigned_type level, bool force_merge_all = false)
4157  {
4158  if (!force_merge_all)
4159  STXXL_DEBUG("Checking external level " << level);
4160 
4161  // return if EA level is not full
4162  if (m_external_levels[level] < c_max_external_level_size && !force_merge_all)
4163  return;
4164 
4165  unsigned_type level_size = 0;
4166  size_type int_memory = 0;
4167  std::vector<unsigned_type> ea_index;
4168 
4169  for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < m_external_arrays.size(); ++i)
4170  {
4171  if (m_external_arrays[i].level() != level && !force_merge_all) continue;
4172  if (m_external_arrays[i].empty()) continue;
4173 
4174  level_size += m_external_arrays[i].size();
4175  int_memory += m_external_arrays[i].int_memory();
4176  ea_index.push_back(i);
4177  }
4178 
4179  // return if there is not enough RAM for the new array.
4180  // TODO: force_merge_all==true is for freeing memory. Breaking here is not
4181  // helpful in this case. But one should maybe reserve some space in advance.
4182  if (m_mem_left < external_array_type::int_memory(level_size) && !force_merge_all)
4183  return;
4184  m_mem_left -= external_array_type::int_memory(level_size);
4185 
4186  STXXL_ASSERT(force_merge_all || c_max_external_level_size == ea_index.size());
4187  unsigned_type num_arrays_to_merge = ea_index.size();
4188 
4189  STXXL_DEBUG("merging external arrays" <<
4190  " level=" << level <<
4191  " level_size=" << level_size <<
4192  " sequences=" << num_arrays_to_merge <<
4193  " force_merge_all=" << force_merge_all);
4194 
4195  // if force_merge_all: create array in highest level to avoid merging
4196  // of such a large EA.
4197  unsigned_type new_level = force_merge_all ? c_max_external_levels - 1 : level + 1;
4198 
4199  // construct new external array
4200  external_array_type ea(level_size, &m_pool, new_level);
4201  {
4202  external_array_writer_type external_array_writer(ea);
4203  typename external_array_writer_type::iterator out_iter
4204  = external_array_writer.begin();
4205 
4206  // === build minima_tree over the level's arrays ===
4207 
4208  s_min_tree_comparator min_tree_comparator(m_external_arrays,
4209  m_inv_compare, ea_index);
4210 
4211  winner_tree<s_min_tree_comparator> min_tree(num_arrays_to_merge,
4212  min_tree_comparator);
4213 
4214  // =================================================
4215 
4216  unsigned_type num_arrays_done = 0;
4217 
4218  while (num_arrays_to_merge != num_arrays_done)
4219  {
4220  STXXL_DEBUG("num_arrays_done = " << num_arrays_done);
4221 
4222  // === build hints ===
4223 
4224  for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < num_arrays_to_merge; ++i) {
4225  if (m_external_arrays[ea_index[i]].has_unhinted_em_data()) {
4226  min_tree.activate_without_replay(i);
4227  }
4228  else {
4229  min_tree.deactivate_without_replay(i);
4230  }
4231  }
4232 
4233  min_tree.rebuild();
4234 
4235  // === fill available memory with read blocks ===
4236  while (m_mem_left >= block_size) {
4237  block_type* new_block = new block_type();
4238  m_pool.add_prefetch(new_block);
4239  ++m_num_read_blocks;
4240  m_mem_left -= block_size;
4241  }
4242  // ==============================================
4243 
4244  // cleanup hints (all arrays, not only the ones to merge)
4245  for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < m_external_arrays.size(); ++i) {
4246  m_external_arrays[i].rebuild_hints_prepare();
4247  }
4248 
4249  // virtually release all hints
4250  unsigned_type free_prefetch_blocks =
4251  m_pool.free_size_prefetch() + m_num_hinted_blocks;
4252  m_num_hinted_blocks = 0;
4253 
4254  int gmin_index_index; // index in ea_index
4255  while (free_prefetch_blocks > 0 &&
4256  (gmin_index_index = min_tree.top()) >= 0)
4257  {
4258  const unsigned_type gmin_index = ea_index[gmin_index_index];
4259  assert(gmin_index < m_external_arrays.size());
4260 
4261  STXXL_DEBUG0("check_external_level():Give pre-hint in EA[" << gmin_index << "] min " <<
4262  m_external_arrays[gmin_index].get_next_hintable_min());
4263 
4264  m_external_arrays[gmin_index].rebuild_hints_prehint_next_block();
4265  --free_prefetch_blocks;
4266  ++m_num_hinted_blocks;
4267 
4268  if (m_external_arrays[gmin_index].has_unhinted_em_data()) {
4269  min_tree.replay_on_change(gmin_index_index);
4270  }
4271  else {
4272  min_tree.deactivate_player(gmin_index_index);
4273  }
4274  }
4275 
4276  // invalidate all hinted blocks no longer needed
4277  // (all arrays, not only the ones to merge)
4278  for (size_t i = 0; i < m_external_arrays.size(); ++i)
4279  m_external_arrays[i].rebuild_hints_cancel();
4280 
4281  // perform real hinting on pre-hinted blocks
4282  // (all arrays, not only the ones to merge)
4283  for (size_t i = 0; i < m_external_arrays.size(); ++i)
4284  m_external_arrays[i].rebuild_hints_finish();
4285 
4286  assert(free_prefetch_blocks == m_pool.free_size_prefetch());
4287 
4288  // ================================ end build hints ======
4289 
4290  // === wait for data ===
4291  for (size_type i = 0; i < num_arrays_to_merge; ++i) {
4292  const unsigned_type index = ea_index[i];
4293 
4294  unsigned_type used_blocks =
4295  m_external_arrays[index].wait_all_hinted_blocks();
4296 
4297  m_num_hinted_blocks -= used_blocks;
4298  m_num_used_read_blocks += used_blocks;
4299  }
4300  // =====================
4301 
4302  // === build sequences ===
4303  std::vector<iterator_pair_type> sequences(num_arrays_to_merge);
4304  std::vector<size_type> sizes(num_arrays_to_merge);
4305 
4306  gmin_index_index = min_tree.top();
4307  bool needs_limit = (gmin_index_index >= 0) ? true : false;
4308 
4309  for (size_type i = 0; i < num_arrays_to_merge; ++i) {
4310  const unsigned_type index = ea_index[i];
4311  iterator begin = m_external_arrays[index].begin();
4312  iterator end = m_external_arrays[index].end();
4313 
4314  if (needs_limit) {
4315  const unsigned_type gmin_index = ea_index[gmin_index_index];
4316  const value_type& gmin_value =
4317  m_external_arrays[gmin_index].get_next_block_min();
4318 
4319  end = std::lower_bound(begin, end,
4320  gmin_value, m_inv_compare);
4321  }
4322 
4323  sizes[i] = std::distance(begin, end);
4324  sequences[i] = std::make_pair(begin, end);
4325 
4326  STXXL_DEBUG("sequence[" << i << "] ea " <<
4327  begin << " - " << end <<
4328  " size " << sizes[i] <<
4329  (needs_limit ? " with ub limit" : ""));
4330  }
4331  // ==========================================
4332 
4333  // === merge ===
4334 
4335  size_type output_size = std::accumulate(sizes.begin(), sizes.end(), 0);
4336 
4337  out_iter = potentially_parallel::multiway_merge(
4338  sequences.begin(), sequences.end(),
4339  out_iter, output_size, m_inv_compare);
4340 
4341  for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < num_arrays_to_merge; ++i) {
4342  const unsigned_type index = ea_index[i];
4343 
4344  if (!m_external_arrays[index].empty()) {
4345  // remove items and free blocks in RAM.
4346  unsigned_type freed_blocks =
4347  m_external_arrays[index].remove_items(sizes[i]);
4348 
4349  m_num_used_read_blocks -= freed_blocks;
4350 
4351  if (m_external_arrays[index].empty())
4352  ++num_arrays_done;
4353  }
4354  }
4355 
4356  // reset read buffer
4357  resize_read_pool();
4358 
4359  // cannot call clear_external_arrays() here, since it
4360  // corrupts ea_index.
4361  }
4362 
4363  if (m_in_bulk_push)
4364  m_bulk_first_delayed_external_array = 0; // TODO: workaround
4365  } // destroy external_array_writer
4366 
4367  // clean up now empty arrays
4368  cleanup_external_arrays();
4369 
4370  m_external_arrays.swap_back(ea);
4371  ++m_external_levels[new_level];
4372 
4373  // register EA in min tree
4374  m_external_min_tree.activate_without_replay(m_external_arrays.size() - 1);
4375  update_external_min_tree(m_external_arrays.size() - 1);
4376 
4377  // register EA in hint tree
4378  m_hint_tree.activate_without_replay(m_external_arrays.size() - 1);
4379  if (!m_in_bulk_push)
4380  update_hint_tree(m_external_arrays.size() - 1);
4381  // else: done in bulk_push_end() -> rebuild_hint_tree()
4382 
4383  STXXL_DEBUG("Merge done of new ea " << &ea);
4384 
4385  if (!force_merge_all)
4386  check_external_level(level + 1);
4387 
4388  check_invariants();
4389  }
4390 
4391  //! Add new internal array, which requires that values are sorted!
4392  //! automatically decreases m_mem_left! also merges internal arrays if
4393  //! there are too many internal arrays on the same level.
4394  void add_as_internal_array(std::vector<value_type>& values,
4395  unsigned_type used = 0,
4396  unsigned_type level = 0)
4397  {
4398  const size_t size = values.size();
4399  const size_t capacity = values.capacity();
4400  assert(size > used); // at least one element
4401 
4402  internal_array_type new_array(values, used, level);
4403  STXXL_ASSERT(new_array.int_memory() ==
4404  internal_array_type::int_memory(capacity));
4405  m_internal_arrays.swap_back(new_array);
4406 
4407  if (!extract_buffer_empty()) {
4408  m_stats.num_new_internal_arrays++;
4409  m_stats.max_num_new_internal_arrays.set_max(
4410  m_stats.num_new_internal_arrays);
4411  m_minima.add_internal_array(
4412  static_cast<unsigned>(m_internal_arrays.size()) - 1
4413  );
4414  }
4415 
4416  m_internal_size += size - used;
4417  m_mem_left -= internal_array_type::int_memory(capacity);
4418 
4419  STXXL_CHECK(level < c_max_internal_levels &&
4420  "Internal array level is larger than anything possible "
4421  "in this universe. Increase the size of m_internal_levels");
4422 
4423  ++m_internal_levels[level];
4424 
4425  m_stats.max_num_internal_arrays.set_max(m_internal_arrays.size());
4426 
4427  // if IA level is too large ...
4428  if (m_internal_levels[level] < c_max_internal_level_size) return;
4429 
4430  unsigned_type level_size = 0;
4431  size_type int_memory = 0;
4432  std::vector<iterator_pair_type> sequences;
4433  std::vector<unsigned_type> ia_index;
4434 
4435  for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < m_internal_arrays.size(); ++i)
4436  {
4437  if (m_internal_arrays[i].level() != level) continue;
4438  if (m_internal_arrays[i].empty()) continue;
4439 
4440  level_size += m_internal_arrays[i].size();
4441  int_memory += m_internal_arrays[i].int_memory();
4442  sequences.push_back(std::make_pair(m_internal_arrays[i].begin(),
4443  m_internal_arrays[i].end()));
4444  ia_index.push_back(i);
4445  }
4446 
4447  // AND there is enough RAM to merge it (without flushing out to EA).
4448  if (m_mem_left < internal_array_type::int_memory(level_size)) return;
4449 
4450  // must free up more memory than the new array needs.
4451  STXXL_ASSERT(int_memory >= internal_array_type::int_memory(level_size));
4452 
4453  STXXL_DEBUG("merging internal arrays" <<
4454  " level=" << level <<
4455  " level_size=" << level_size <<
4456  " sequences=" << sequences.size());
4457 
4458  std::vector<value_type> merged_array(level_size);
4459 
4460  potentially_parallel::multiway_merge(
4461  sequences.begin(), sequences.end(),
4462  merged_array.begin(), level_size, m_inv_compare);
4463 
4464  // release memory of old internal arrays immediately
4465  for (unsigned_type i = 0; i < ia_index.size(); ++i)
4466  {
4467  unsigned_type ia = ia_index[i];
4468  m_internal_arrays[ia].make_empty();
4469  // this is done in cleanup_internal_arrays()...
4470  //if (ia < m_minima.ia_slots())
4471  // m_minima.deactivate_internal_array(ia);
4472  }
4473 
4474  cleanup_internal_arrays();
4475 
4476  // in add_as_internal_array the level_size is re-added!
4477  m_internal_size -= level_size;
4478 
4479  // add as new internal array at next level (and maybe recursively merge)
4480  add_as_internal_array(merged_array, 0, level + 1);
4481  }
4482 
4483  /*!
4484  * Sorts the values from values and writes them into an internal array.
4485  * Don't use the value vector afterwards!
4486  *
4487  * \param values the vector to sort and store
4488  */
4489  void flush_array_internal(std::vector<value_type>& values)
4490  {
4491  potentially_parallel::sort(values.begin(), values.end(), m_inv_compare);
4492 
4493  // flush until enough memory for new array
4494  flush_ia_ea_until_memory_free(
4495  internal_array_type::int_memory(values.size())
4496  );
4497 
4498  add_as_internal_array(values);
4499  }

4501  //! Struct of all statistical counters and timers. Turn on/off statistics
4502  //! using the stats_counter and stats_timer typedefs.
4503  struct stats_type
4504  {
4505  //! Largest number of elements in the extract buffer at the same time
4506  stats_counter max_extract_buffer_size;
4507 
4508  //! Sum of the sizes of each extract buffer refill. Used for average
4509  //! size.
4510  stats_counter total_extract_buffer_size;
4511 
4512  //! Largest number of elements in the merge buffer when running
4513  //! flush_internal_arrays()
4514  stats_counter max_merge_buffer_size;
4515 
4516  //! Total number of extracts
4517  stats_counter num_extracts;
4518 
4519  //! Number of refill_extract_buffer() calls
4520  stats_counter num_extract_buffer_refills;
4521 
4522  //! Number of flush_insertion_heaps() calls
4523  stats_counter num_insertion_heap_flushes;
4524 
4525  //! Number of flush_directly_to_hd() calls
4526  stats_counter num_direct_flushes;
4527 
4528  //! Number of flush_internal_arrays() calls
4529  stats_counter num_internal_array_flushes;
4530 
4531  //! Number of merge_external_arrays() calls
4532  stats_counter num_external_array_merges;
4533 
4534  //! Largest number of internal arrays at the same time
4535  stats_counter max_num_internal_arrays;
4536 
4537  //! Largest number of external arrays at the same time
4538  stats_counter max_num_external_arrays;
4539 
4540  //! Temporary number of new external arrays at the same time (which
4541  //! were created while the extract buffer hadn't been empty)
